So, I am running this pre-order campaign to gauge interest in this project and get these little pins into the world where I feel they clearly belong.Since that fateful night, Sumo + Cats became an obsession for me and I would spend hours each day going down the rabbit hole of Sumo trading cards - called Menko online. I found the most fascinating information at an incredible SumoCards blog  run by Ryan Laughton, who has been instrumental in helping me design the cards.Menko which means "small object with face"  goes all the way back to the 1700’s when they started with small circular discs of clay depicting favorite personalities of the day. They were first replaced by lead disks then were wisely replaced by paper in the early 1900’s due to awareness of lead poisoning! In the 1920’s Menko experienced another change, moving from woodblock printing to half-tone bromide printing and taking on die cut shapes of animals and airplanes. And, slowly as the quality of the printing improved over time, instead of destroying their Menko in battle, kids found value in collecting them. Sumo trading cards started appearing in the 1930's and enjoyed a huge boom in popularity in the 1950's and if you see vintage Sumo Menko it's likely from this period.  As you can see already - the history is so fascinating and rich. I encourage you to visit Ryan’s SumoBlog if you want to learn more.Vintage Menko courtesy of SumoCards Blog Each pin will approximately be 0.75" tall. Yokozuna Taiho with Yoko-neko-zuna Tai-kawai-ho pinI am particularly fascinated by Menko in the 1940’s which my packaging is based on. I like that’s when there was that magical collision between the ability to create and manufacturing processes being advanced enough to support that creativity. To stay true to the period, instead of creating the art on the computer, I sketched and painted each of these designs and then put them through a half-tone filter to mimic the printing processes.I also want point out the Chonmage, the original man bun, on the kitties. Initially I incorrectly drew these as little bumps on the cat’s heads but I was soon directed to draw these properly in the shape of a Gingko leaf.I used this a Blackwing Pencil (which I highly recommend, the lead is like velvet), my favorite Staedtler eraser and Gouache paints to create the art for the kitties.Based on Ryan’s expert suggestions, I focused on these three top Sumo wrestlers:1. Futabayama who popularized the sport of Sumo.2. Taiho who became a Yokozuna at 21, the youngest ever at the time.3. Chiyonofuji who was considered as one of the greatest yokozuna of recent times and known as "the Wolf" for his ferocity and masculine facial features.I took some liberties to spin the names a little - adding NYA (meow in Japanese), NEKO (cat) and KAWAI (cute). Although I am Chinese, I am told by my Japanese friends that these are in fact playful renditions of the names. Futabayama has become Futaba - nya - ma, Taiho Tai-Kawai-ho (be sure to draw out the word Ka-wai to make it sound extra cute) and Chiyonofuji is Chiyo-Nya-Fuij.On the back of each card, you will see the name of the wrestler, their actual height and weight, their traditional fighting number and a phrase in Japanese - which I will let you figure out. The little paw in the bottom RH corner, that’s a kitty version of rock, paper, scissors a traditional game that kids used to play with the cards. And that little empty box, why that’s where my signature will be! Yes, I am going to hand sign each card - and in the spirit of collectible cards, any pre-sale pins purchased with this campaign will be autographed in a gold ink. All others will be in black.Why the red line? That is the die line and I create it on the computer.  I like to do it in another color so the printer knows not to print the "red" line. Yokozuna Chiyonofuji with Yoko-neko-zuna Chiyo-nya-fuji pin.You will receive a lovely enamel Sumo Cat pin (or pins) depending on your perk. Shipping via US first class mail is free anywhere in the US and each and only pre-sale card will be autographed in gold ink!Production will start when I have raised base funds and it takes 4 - 6 weeks to produce these little guys. So expect your pins in the mail in about 7 weeks around MAY 2017.Let me know if you have any questions!MEOWS!Lynn

story:
Caliber X is a business casual apparel brand for the new age professional that specializes in the use of sustainable and eco-friendly materials for our collections. We're building Caliber X into a leading lifestyle brand for socially conscious millennial consumers. 

 

Our journey began over a year ago. The idea started to develop when founder, Brittany began to realize the lack of options for business casual clothing while she worked in New York City. After conversing with other young professionals, she came to the conclusion that the niche market for business casual clothing needed a change. Just because we work in a corporate setting doesn't mean we need to lack personality and style while also looking credible. In addition, she noticed the quality associated with these garments. The price point and the quality of fabric did not coincide. Her solution -  create a brand of clothing for both men and women that 1. fit the basic dress code of many corporate businesses, 2. functional for the everyday lifestyle, 3. stylish for outside of the office when needed. Brittany teamed up with her cousin, Brett to bring on a male style and design opinion and assist her on this crazy journey. Through workshops, many fabric swatch testing, design revamping, and LOTS of "googling" and youtube, we are here to present Caliber X's first collection. 

     

    We're committed to using environmentally friendly fabrics in our designs, that also look and feel great. For our collection, we used some of the following fabrics:

    Cupro (and Bemberg) - Lining for Men's Jacket and Women's Wrap Dress:

    • Breathable – allows for moisture to evaporate while it also wicks sweat and humidity away from your body. 
    • Anti-Static – Provides more comfortable and allows for the garment to slide on and off very smoothly.
    • Environmentally Friendly – Biodegradable material; a greener alternative to synthetic fibres.
    • Affordable – Not cheaper than polyester, but more affordable than silk and represents incredibly good value for money. 
    • Durable – While a suit with a silk lining will cost more, you’ll likely need to replace that lining at some point. With proper care, a Cupro lined garment may not need to replace it at all.

    Italian Wool - Main Fabric for Men's Jacket, Men's Trousers, and Women's Wrap Dres:

    • Characterized by high elasticity; can reach an elasticity up to 18%
    • Guarantee a perfect fit with a performance ideal also for leisure

    Supernova - Women's Trousers: 

    • Shrink and Wrinkle Resistance
    • Easy Washability & Incredible Elasticity with Good Return
    • Modified to Dry Quickly
    • Requires little or no pressing

    Other fabrics included:

    • Chinese Brocade Silk - Men's Shirt
    • Lambskin Leather - Trim on Women's Wrap Dress
    • Repreve Spandex - Bottom Half of Women's Bodysuit
    • Cotton Broadcloth - Main Fabric for Men's Shirt
    • Silk - Bodice of Women's Bodysuit 

    WOMEN'S 

     

     

    MEN'S

     

     

     **If something doesn't fit, we are happy to exchange it for another size if available. We cannot offer returns for Indiegogo orders.

    Please email info@caliberxco.com if you have an questions about sizing.

     

     

     

     

     

     

    Our manufacturing partner is a family-run company in New York City's historic garment district. Many of the employees have worked there for over a decade. We visit the factory often, and work together closely. 

    We're committed to using responsible factories that pay legal wages, ensure workplace safety, and prohibit unlawful labor and discrimination. It's one of our passions to support companies that treat their employees with dignity and respect, and provide job opportunities in the U.S.

     

    If you are interested in learning more, or would like to write a story about us, you can download our press kit "HERE" or email Brittany @ info@caliberxco.com

    How does the discount work?

    • You will back our campaign at full price
    • Once our campaign ends, a survey will be sent out and you will be able to input a discount code
    • Once we receive your completed survey, we will refund your account for the amount of the discount  (You won't get charged until our campaign ends so the charge and the discount will happen in the same billing cycle)

     

      We've sourced our fabric and trimmings from amazing companies from across the world. Our production team has over 20 years of fashion-making experience. As a small business, we have the capability to shift and pivot when challenges arise. 

      Delays may become apparent in the production and delivery of our fabric and garments; however, we aim to communicate clearly with our backers during the entire process with any updates. We will do our absolute best to meet and exceed expectations. We ask that you remain patience in the process with us. 

      The final garments and colors may vary slightly from the pictures. We will offer free size exchanges to ensure you get the right fit and size for you. However, we cannot offer returns for Indiegogo orders.

      Finally, we want to give a HUGE thank you to everyone who have supported or played a role in getting Caliber X to this point in our journey. We could not have gotten here without the help of those who assisted in color options, provided feedback on design options, shared our campaign page, and uplifted us from day one! Building a business takes community effort and we are pleased to have such a huge community. 

      WEBSITE: www.caliberxco.com

      EMAIL: info@caliberxco.com

      FACEBOOK: www.facebook.com/caliberxco

      TWITTER: www.twitter.com/caliberxco #caliberxco 

      INSTAGRAM: www.instagram.com/caliberxco #caliberxco

      Learn more about the team: https://www.caliberxco.com/who-are-we/ 

       

      What Will My Contribution Be Used For?

      It's been a complete pleasure creating and building Caliber X. With any business, there are administrative and operating costs. If you choose to pre-order and/or give a contribution, the funds will cover the following expenses:

      • Licensing Fees
      • Professional services (Accounting and Law Services)
      • Legal Fees
      • Raw Materials (Fabric, Trims, Notions, Labels)
      • Marketing/Advertising Fees
      • Sample Production Fees (Pattern/Sample Making, Pattern Grading)
      • Manufacturing/Production Fees
      • Shipping/Delivery Fees
      • Public Relations Services

       

      Can you explain more about cost for each piece?

      As an emerging brand, 

      1. Manufacturing is being run in the U.S. - We take pride in producing on American soil. For our first production run it makes sense to stay local rather than produce overseas where we can't physically see the process and still have to pay for carrier fees. Costs for us will be high either way.

      2. Unlike big retail brands who can produce in bulk at a lower cost, we have not hit the big leagues. We are not at the level to produce high qualities that would reduce the amount of production costs and raw materials tremendously. 

      3. Processing fees - Indiegogo, like other crowdfunding campaigns are great for launching brands; however they do come with a price. Using their platform is free, while processing every order comes at a cost. We have accounted for those fees in the cost of each piece. 

      4. Shipping fees - We are also shipping out each piece personally rather than using a distribution center. 

      5. Quality Products - As you have read, we take pride in the research and material we use to create Caliber X. We strive for good quality. Again, as with anything, quality comes at a price. 

       

      What's the timeline for receiving the pieces?

      The campaign will run for 30 days and end in November. Shortly after, we will move into production. Given the many moving parts coming together for the first time in this inaugural production run, we've estimated that we will inspect each piece by December and ship out each order before the end of the year. If any changes in the timeline occur, we will be sure to update you on the process.

       

      How do I pick a product color?

      We've got you covered! Here is how Indiegogo works:

      - We receive your contact information when you contribute

      - Once the campaign is over, we'll reach out to confirm the size and color you'd like

       

      I'm having trouble with Paypal or am not sure that my payment went through.  What can I do to complete my contribution?

      Sorry to hear about the difficulty!  If you're having any trouble at all contributing via Paypal, or if you want to confirm that your payment went through, please contact us at info@caliberxco.com.  We'll do everything we can to smooth it out and make it as simple as possible for you!

story:
MDK

An original way of addressing the massive imbalance of male/female choices and freedom

MDK is an online store selling graphic clothing with a message. This message is feminist in nature and focuses on the imbalance in the sexual experience, specifically promoting oral sex for women. We wish to use humor, which we believe is a powerful vector for change.

The clothing:

Great quality, sustainable, beautiful designs

MDK clothing is of very high quality and made to last. All t-shirts and hoodies are sustainable – both environmentally and socially. 

The designs are not sexually explicit and typically will refer in a subtle way to our message. Explanations for the designs will be on the MDK website, the goal being that customers will be excited to discover the story and inspiration behind each new product.

Each new design – or episode – will be released monthly over a six-month period for the first season. Subsequent seasons will have six or more episodes depending on the success of the first season.

The movement:

Customers are actors for change

MDK will not only sell clothing, it will also promote a movement. People who purchase MDK clothing will be part of a fun and positive movement for social change. Wearing MDK clothing will be a statement.

MDK members will be encouraged to send in pictures and short videos of themselves wearing MDK clothing, which will be posted on the MDK website (homepage slideshow and product pages) as well as our social media pages. We do not use professional models and wish to fight the "beauty" norms perpetuated by the fashion industry, and pop culture in general. Our platforms will be available for our members to voice opinions, funny stories, reactions to MDK from others, ideas for future products, and other topics.

The Funding:

The funding for this campaign will go to getting prototypes of our first season’s episodes, as well as promotional work to get the MDK name out into the world. It will allow us to organize contests and giveaways. Of course, the funding also goes to fulfilling your perks. Perks range from stickers and special numbered t-shirts only available for this campaign, to working with MDK on a future design.

Thanks so much in advance to everyone who supports MDK and its mission to promote equality in the sexual experience, while looking good and having fun. And for those of you who like what we’re trying to do, but cannot contribute financially, you can still be a part of the movement by spreading the word about MDK and this campaign to your friends.  

The Perks:

story:
Truly beautiful shoes are more than skin deep. Who makes them, where they're made and what they're made of, is everything. Part of Loyal Footwear’s mission is to improve footwear manufacturing and protect our planet by shattering the myth that animal leather equates to higher quality.

 

 

We're an all-women team making animal-free shoes of high style and comfort with sustainable methods where shoemakers earn fair wages in the USA. We are changing the dynamic of shoe making and availability by creating an accessibly-priced vegan shoe line, using the cleanest materials available, with a pricing structure to support being manufactured locally with love, right here, in-house. 

 

 

What we believe are the best ways of doing absolutely everything converge in this single collection. We use lower environmental-impact raw materials including vegan upper materials free of animal products and byproducts avoiding the toxic mess that is animal-hide tanning. Instead we use plant-based textiles such as Piñatex, recycled rubber, cork, ultrasuede linings with recycled fibers, and durable microfiber vegan leather — and absolutely everything we use is PVC-free.

 

 

Loyal shoes are designed to be durable and long-lasting. When you buy better, you buy less and own something you'll use everyday. 

 

 

They are also designed to be repairable. When the time comes, just send your shoes back to us. For a small fee we will revive your soles, significantly extending the shoes' lifecycle. 

 

 

We maintain a small inventory, creating less waste. The shoes are made-to-order, or made in small batches, then sold directly to you.

 

 

They're designed for everyday wear, prioritizing your comfort without compromising your style. We choose materials for their softness, flexibility, and quick break-in time and use a minimal amount of stabilizers and stiffeners for a generous, flexible fit.

 

 

Only 1% of shoes purchased in the USA are made in the USA. We want to increase the percentage of locally-made shoes purchased in the United States. We have all become accustomed to paying low prices for shoes as a result of outsourced production, too often to parts of the world that allow companies to exploit workers. By keeping production here in the United States, we ensure there is fairness in our production system from beginning to end.

 

Buying direct from us ensures the majority of what you spend goes directly to the shoemakers. 

 

Our shoes reflect our values — using materials of known origin and processing without animal products or byproducts. Leather is not just a passive byproduct of the meat industry. The skin of the animal is considered to be one of the most significant economic co-products of the meatpacking industry. 

Animal leather is often marketed as being ‘eco-friendly’ because it’s ‘biodegradable’ — neither of which are true. The whole point of tanning is to stop the leather from biodegrading by stabilizing the collagen and protein fibers. Making leather from animals is extremely destructive: trees are cut down to create pastureland, vast quantities of water are used, and run-off from feedlots is a major source of water pollution. This is why animal leathers receive such a high impact score on the Higg Index. 

 

Implementing a Sustainable Material Mix: The Higg Index is the measure of an apparel or footwear raw material’s environmental impact based on the combination of these four categories: 

  • Global Warming (emissions) 
  • Eutrophication (water pollution) 
  • Water Scarcity (water consumption) 
  • Abiotic Resource depletion (fossil fuels) 

Polyurethane alternatives to leather already have a low raw material impact (see below). Even more so if the durability and the full lifecycle of a complete shoe is accounted for. This is mostly due to the many advancements in microfiber vegan leathers that have made them stronger than their animal-derived counterparts. They are polishable and repairable, and are no longer subject to the cracking and peeling of leatherettes of yesteryear.

 

This Kickstarter will help us to...

 

 

make your shoes,

 

 

support our workers,

 

 

continue to innovate,

 

 

grow our staff,

 

 

and prove that it is possible to craft an affordably-priced shoe here in the U.S.

 

We’re always looking into new techniques, and new materials just hitting the market. We can’t continue to evolve without your help. You’ll be supporting not only where we are now, but more importantly, where we're going. 

Contribute whatever you can, it all matters, every single dollar brings us all closer to our shared mission of making animal-free shoes here in the U.S. 

 

 

We have five beautiful, animal-free and PVC-free materials available across our eight styles. Your style/color choice will be collected in the survey at the end of the campaign so don’t worry, you have plenty of time to decide! 

 

Fortunately, we met our stretch goal of $45K on Kickstarter, so we now offer half sizes, larger sizes (12.5, 13, 13.5, 14), and wider widths!

Please reach out to support@loyalfootwear.com for any sizing specific questions, or just send us a message here on Indiegogo! 

 

 

We're excited to now offer a deluxe tote bag option for only $38 more. Check out the add-on options with our perks. This thing is so great, the bottom is made out of recycled rubber inner tubes! 

 

Rebecca Heykes — BK Shoe Factory Co-Founder; Loyal Footwear Design Director

 

Keiko Hirosue — BK Shoe Factory Co-Founder; Brooklyn Shoe Space Founder 

 

We met in 2014 teaching classes together at Keiko’s shoemaking space in Brooklyn. In 2015 we adding consulting and prototyping services for clients, and with two additional partners we spun the consulting services into a new small-batch production factory in 2016. 

In 2017, we conceived of a factory-direct line of shoes to provide a high-quality, locally-made product with the highest value, and in 2018 when we began developing this line it was clear that it was the perfect opportunity to showcase beautiful, sustainable, vegan shoemaking. 

We have built the foundation of our footwear manufacturing space over the past 2.5 years and now we're ready to grow. 

The Loyal Team (circa 2018)

 

 

Even if you are unable to pledge today, you can help us by sharing our story with your friends and family on Facebook.  

 

 

Follow us on Instagram to be the first to know when new styles are released and for more behind-the-scenes photos and videos of your shoes being made. 

 

 

To access hi-res branded and non-branded shoe imagery, photos of our staff, our factory space and our logo, please click the Dropbox link below. Don't hesitate to contact us with press inquiries or for any specific image requests at hello@loyalfootwear.com.
story_txt:
Truly beautiful shoes are more than skin deep. Who makes them, where they're made and what they're made of, is everything. Part of Loyal Footwear’s mission is to improve footwear manufacturing and protect our planet by shattering the myth that animal leather equates to higher quality.
 

 
We're an all-women team making animal-free shoes of high style and comfort with sustainable methods where shoemakers earn fair wages in the USA. We are changing the dynamic of shoe making and availability by creating an accessibly-priced vegan shoe line, using the cleanest materials available, with a pricing structure to support being manufactured locally with love, right here, in-house. 
 

 
What we believe are the best ways of doing absolutely everything converge in this single collection. We use lower environmental-impact raw materials including vegan upper materials free of animal products and byproducts avoiding the toxic mess that is animal-hide tanning. Instead we use plant-based textiles such as Piñatex, recycled rubber, cork, ultrasuede linings with recycled fibers, and durable microfiber vegan leather — and absolutely everything we use is PVC-free.
 


 
Loyal shoes are designed to be durable and long-lasting. When you buy better, you buy less and own something you'll use everyday. 
 


 
They are also designed to be repairable. When the time comes, just send your shoes back to us. For a small fee we will revive your soles, significantly extending the shoes' lifecycle. 
 

 
We maintain a small inventory, creating less waste. The shoes are made-to-order, or made in small batches, then sold directly to you.
 

 
They're designed for everyday wear, prioritizing your comfort without compromising your style. We choose materials for their softness, flexibility, and quick break-in time and use a minimal amount of stabilizers and stiffeners for a generous, flexible fit.
 


 
Only 1% of shoes purchased in the USA are made in the USA. We want to increase the percentage of locally-made shoes purchased in the United States. We have all become accustomed to paying low prices for shoes as a result of outsourced production, too often to parts of the world that allow companies to exploit workers. By keeping production here in the United States, we ensure there is fairness in our production system from beginning to end.

 
Buying direct from us ensures the majority of what you spend goes directly to the shoemakers. 

 
Our shoes reflect our values — using materials of known origin and processing without animal products or byproducts. Leather is not just a passive byproduct of the meat industry. The skin of the animal is considered to be one of the most significant economic co-products of the meatpacking industry. 
Animal leather is often marketed as being ‘eco-friendly’ because it’s ‘biodegradable’ — neither of which are true. The whole point of tanning is to stop the leather from biodegrading by stabilizing the collagen and protein fibers. Making leather from animals is extremely destructive: trees are cut down to create pastureland, vast quantities of water are used, and run-off from feedlots is a major source of water pollution. This is why animal leathers receive such a high impact score on the Higg Index. 
 

Implementing a Sustainable Material Mix: The Higg Index is the measure of an apparel or footwear raw material’s environmental impact based on the combination of these four categories: 

Global Warming (emissions) 
Eutrophication (water pollution) 
Water Scarcity (water consumption) 
Abiotic Resource depletion (fossil fuels) 

Polyurethane alternatives to leather already have a low raw material impact (see below). Even more so if the durability and the full lifecycle of a complete shoe is accounted for. This is mostly due to the many advancements in microfiber vegan leathers that have made them stronger than their animal-derived counterparts. They are polishable and repairable, and are no longer subject to the cracking and peeling of leatherettes of yesteryear.

 
This Kickstarter will help us to...
 

 
make your shoes,
 

 
support our workers,
 

 
continue to innovate,
 

 
grow our staff,
 

 
and prove that it is possible to craft an affordably-priced shoe here in the U.S.
 
We’re always looking into new techniques, and new materials just hitting the market. We can’t continue to evolve without your help. You’ll be supporting not only where we are now, but more importantly, where we're going. 
Contribute whatever you can, it all matters, every single dollar brings us all closer to our shared mission of making animal-free shoes here in the U.S. 

 









 

We have five beautiful, animal-free and PVC-free materials available across our eight styles. Your style/color choice will be collected in the survey at the end of the campaign so don’t worry, you have plenty of time to decide! 






 

Fortunately, we met our stretch goal of $45K on Kickstarter, so we now offer half sizes, larger sizes (12.5, 13, 13.5, 14), and wider widths!

Please reach out to support@loyalfootwear.com for any sizing specific questions, or just send us a message here on Indiegogo! 
 


 
We're excited to now offer a deluxe tote bag option for only $38 more. Check out the add-on options with our perks. This thing is so great, the bottom is made out of recycled rubber inner tubes! 

 


Rebecca Heykes — BK Shoe Factory Co-Founder; Loyal Footwear Design Director
 

Keiko Hirosue — BK Shoe Factory Co-Founder; Brooklyn Shoe Space Founder 
 

We met in 2014 teaching classes together at Keiko’s shoemaking space in Brooklyn. In 2015 we adding consulting and prototyping services for clients, and with two additional partners we spun the consulting services into a new small-batch production factory in 2016. 
In 2017, we conceived of a factory-direct line of shoes to provide a high-quality, locally-made product with the highest value, and in 2018 when we began developing this line it was clear that it was the perfect opportunity to showcase beautiful, sustainable, vegan shoemaking. 
We have built the foundation of our footwear manufacturing space over the past 2.5 years and now we're ready to grow. 

The Loyal Team (circa 2018)
 






 

Even if you are unable to pledge today, you can help us by sharing our story with your friends and family on Facebook.  

 
 

Follow us on Instagram to be the first to know when new styles are released and for more behind-the-scenes photos and videos of your shoes being made. 

 
 

To access hi-res branded and non-branded shoe imagery, photos of our staff, our factory space and our logo, please click the Dropbox link below. Don't hesitate to contact us with press inquiries or for any specific image requests at hello@loyalfootwear.com.

story: Introducing the newest addition to our line of wallets, a rendition of our most popular wallet yet, the Ideka Bifold. We took everyone's feedback and requests from all our previous wallets into consideration when designing this and believe we've created the perfect wallet, whether you carry cards, cash or coins, we've made it easy to do so efficiently.

story:
WHERE FASHION MEETS FUNCTION

Visit us at www.aquaheadwear.com.

Did we mention we want to waterproof your life??? AQUA Waterproof Headwear is the ONLY line of fashionable yet TOTALLY WATERPROOF headwear. We were extremely frustrated with the existing options for keeping our hair dry at the beach and pool and in everyday inclement weather while maintaining our fashion style. Our options were either flimsy (plastic caps), or hot, tight and ugly (swim caps) and let’s face it, didn’t work! They make our scalp sweat, thus ruining our hair, and don’t totally protect from the moisture, water, rain or humidity. I think we can all relate to this. So WE CREATED A BETTER SOLUTION! One that is TOTALLY WATERPROOF, STYLISH, BREATHABLE, SOFT, STRETCHY, & COMPACT (can literally fit in your purse)!

 

Take a look the videos below to see how AQUA WATERPROOF HEADWEAR will waterproof your life…

 

You can go to the hair salon in the rain or humidity without worrying about your hair or compromising your fashion style!

 

You can enjoy time at the pool or beach without worrying about your hair or compromising your fashion style!

 

You can enjoy a night out even when it's raining or humid outside, without having to worry about your hair or compromising your fashion style!

 

 

You've been outside on a rainy or misty day and an umbrella was inconvenient (i.e., commuting to work, carrying a baby or toddler, grocery shopping, etc.), take a look at how the AQUA Turban saved the day during a rainy day commute to work without an umbrella!

 

HOW TO WATERPROOF YOUR LIFE!

 

This campaign is your EXCLUSIVE OPPORTUNITY to purchase at INTRODUCTORY PRICES!!!  Help us meet and EXCEED our funding goal!

 

LIMITED QUANTITIES at INTRODUCTORY PRICES are available for backers of this Campaign and will be shipped in June 2019.  We are producing set quantities of each design for our 1st production run. When we sellout of a design you really like and you still want to order, don’t fret! Go ahead and order! You will still get the intro prices; however, your item will be sent out in the next shipment in August 2019.

If you want to make a general donation without selecting a perk, click the pink "BACK IT" button.

 

DESIGNS OPTIONS

 

Now CHECK OUT our AQUA HEADWEAR DESIGN OPTIONS!  

 

 

 
There's so many different ways to tie & wear the Glam Wrap.
Here's one example:
 
 

 

OUR FABRIC

 

 

LOCAL PRODUCTION

 

As a small woman-owned business in the United States (US),  we make every effort possible to support the US economy. Currently, our designs are manufactured in the US.  We are working with a local manufacturer that has significant industry experience, designing and producing luxury garments that compliment our headwear.

 

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING

AQUA on Vacation

 

AQUA On the Go

 

AQUA Mom Life

 

So Many Options!

 

AQUA IN USE

 

OUR STORY

 

Hi!  We're Khadijah and Kiana, co-owners of the Kay & Kay Group.  We met while living on the same floor in our freshman dorm at Temple University.  We quickly bonded and eventually realized we shared a similar passion for learning about and coming up with new product ideas!  We enjoy wearing our hair in various hairstyles (natural, extensions, braids, you name it, we’ve tried it), which means we spend a great deal of time, effort and financial resources to maintain those hairstyles.  Of course we want to protect our investment! We are sure you all can relate! When we began discussing and researching waterproof yet fashionable headwear, we couldn't find anything that was TOTALLY WATERPROOF, STYLISH, BREATHABLE, SOFT, STRETCHY & COMPACT.  Trust us, we purchased and tried just about everything on the market!  It was then that we KNEW we had to invent our own.  

 

We’ve been working on AQUA Waterproof Headwear over the past 5 years and KNOW that we’ve created the perfect solution and are ready to share this amazing and greatly needed product with YOU! The Kay & Kay Group strives to enhance our customers’ every day experiences with innovative and insightful products. ​We researches your habits, motives, and what you really want in a product. Our mission is to develop innovative products that function easily, solve everyday problems and enhance the lifestyles of our customers. We are EXTREMELY excited to introduce our first product to the world.  Trust us it’s going to change your life!!! We know you will LOVE AQUA Waterproof Headwear!!!! DON’T MISS OUT! LET US WATERPROOF YOUR LIFE!! PURCHASE ONE TODAY!

 

THANK YOU

story:
We are raising money to continue to develop new products and designs, please help us reach our goal in order to keep bringing you better products for the combat sports industry!

Anyone remember Mr. Yuk?! These Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu shirts are based on the late 70's and early 80's fear campaign for poison control, it was supposed to keep kids from drinking poisons by recognizing this symbol on the package.

  • Black Shirt
  • Poly-Cotton (50% Polyester / 50% Ring-Spun Combed Cotton)
  • Fits slim
  • Hand made


Hand-Printed shirts have a unique quality that is hard to reproduce, creating a worn in look with slight variations in design appearance.

 Made in the U.S.A.

Unlike other Poly-Cotton t-shirts on the market, ours is made with combed cotton, giving it an ultra soft, worn in feel and superior drape. Shirt should be washed before first use.

We stand behind our product and shipping is always FREE inside the US


These shirts are limited edition and ALREADY MADE, once they're gone, we will not make any more...


we just added some new perks!!

3.5" 100% embroidered patch:


10" Dye-Sublimation printed Gi-Patch:



Cheers,

the Brawlsy Team

story:
***** OUR ONLINE SHOP IS NOW OPEN. SHOP AT olibou.com ! *****

 

As seen on Global News in Canada

 

***** For family and friends of parents of children with achondroplasia (dwarfism): You can purchase credits and transfer them to anyone you'd like. Please also note that the collection will ship worldwide :) *****

 

THE VISION

Perfect fit

With the help of many parents of children with achondroplasia, we've built custom size charts to ensure that every item fits to perfection. No more rolled up sleeves, pant legs or stretched collar!

Autonomy

Dressing up by themselves can be a big challenge for children with achondroplasia.  That's why every item in our collection is designed with autonomy in mind. Clothes are easy to put on and to take off. Jeans and pants even include loops hidden inside the pants to make putting them on a breeze!

Breathability

Have you ever noticed that your child sweats a lot?! From organic bamboo rayon to lightweight cotton blends, all Oli & Bou fabrics are chosen with breathability in mind. 

Uniqueness

Oli & Bou makes clothes for children with achondroplasia only. Designs are simple, pure, and truly unique.

THE COLLECTION

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

THE PEOPLE

 

 

This is the family behind Oli & Bou. Our oldest son, Olivier (Oli), is now five years old. When he came into our lives we had no idea what was in store for us. We quickly realized that everything that we took for granted, he would have to fight for. He has amazed us with his will and determination at every step. Oli & Bou is our tribute to him and to children like him.

For those wondering, "Bou" (pronounced boo) is for Olivier's younger brother, Simon, who's nickname is Buddha/Bou-Bou.

None of this would have been possible without the tremendous work of our lead designer, Laurence Béliveau. Her passion for fashion and her attachment to the cause are really what made Oli & Bou possible.

 

PLEDGES

Each backer will receive a store credit in the amount equivalent to the selected reward applicable when the collection is available online.

 

TIMELINE

The first Oli & Bou collection will be available for purchase online at olibou.com starting in the December 2016 and will ship worldwide.

 

THANK YOU!

We want to personally thank you for your support...and for simply taking the time to scroll to the bottom of this page :) You've earned this hashtag: #oliboualltheway

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Creating this clothing line is certainly not an easy task. Potential obstacles may come in the form of production delays although we will take all means necessary to avoid those.

It's also worth mentioning that colors and patterns may vary when the collection is available as we are still selecting the best options.

With the help of other parents of children with achondroplasia we've established size charts custom made for children with achondroplasia. We've taken great care in finding the optimal sizes for ages 1 to 5 but there may be unknowns. Final fittings might require us to make adjustments to certain designs. We are committed to tackling those as well.

 
*** VERSION FRANÇAISE! ***
 
LA VISION
 
L'ajustement parfait!
Avec l'aide de nombreux parents d'enfants atteints d'achondroplasie, nous avons établi une charte de mesures personnalisée. Ainsi, chaque item convient à la perfection. Nous pouvons enfin dire au revoir aux manches et pantalons roulés ainsi qu'aux encolures étirées!
L'autonomie
S'habiller d'eux-mêmes peut être un grand défi pour les enfants atteints d'achondroplasie. Voilà pourquoi chaque item de notre collection est conçu pour favoriser l'autonomie et par le fait même promouvoir la confiance en soi.
Le confort
Avez-vous remarqué que votre enfant transpire beaucoup?! La plupart de nos vêtements sont fabriqués avec des tissus à base de bambou ce qui assure un confort maximal pour nos p'tits loups.
Unique
Oli & Bou conçoit des vêtements pour les enfants atteints d'achondroplasie seulement. Nos designs sont simples, épurés et vraiment uniques.
 
La famille
Derrière Oli & Bou se cache une jeune famille. Notre fils aîné, Olivier ( Oli ), est maintenant âgé de cinq ans. Quand il est entré dans nos vies, nous ne savions pas à quoi nous attendre. Nous nous sommes rapidement rendu compte qu'il aurait à se battre pour accomplir tout ce que nous prenions pour acquis. Il nous émerveille par sa volonté et sa détermination à chaque étape. Oli & Bou est un hommage à lui et aux enfants comme lui. 
 
Pour ceux qui se pose la question, " Bou " vient du petit frère d'Olivier, Simon, que l'on surnomme Bouddha ou Bou - Bou.
 
Rien de tout cela aurait été possible sans l'énorme travail de notre designer en chef, Laurence Béliveau. Sa passion pour la mode et son attachement à la cause ont permis à Oli & Bou de passer de rêve à réalité. Merci Laurence!
 
Vos contributions
Chaque contributeur recevra un crédit d'un montant équivalent à l'option (contrepartie) choisie applicable sur tout achat lorsque la collection sera disponible en ligne.
 
Disponibilité
La première collection d'Oli & Bou sera disponible en ligne au olibou.com à partir de décembre 2016 et ce, partout dans le monde.
 
Merci, merci, mille fois merci!
Nous vous remercions du fond du coeur pour votre soutien...ou pour tout simplement avoir pris le temps de vous rendre au bas de cette page :) Vous méritez ce hashtag : #oliboujusquaubout
 
Risques et défis
La création de cette ligne de vêtements n'est certainement pas une tâche facile. Les obstacles potentiels peuvent se présenter sous la forme de retards de production, bien que nous prendrons tous les moyens nécessaires pour éviter ceux-ci. 
Il est également à noter que les couleurs et les motifs finaux pourront varier lorsque la collection sera disponible en ligne. 
Avec l'aide d'autres parents d'enfants atteints d'achondroplasie, nous avons établi un charte de mesures pour les enfants atteints d'achondroplasie. Nous avons pris grand soin de trouver les tailles optimales pour les âges 1 à 5, mais il peut y avoir des inconnues. Nous nous engageons à mener à bien ce projet malgré tout bien évidemment.

Rien de tout cela aurait été possible sans l'énorme travail de notre designer en chef, Laurence Béliveau. Sa passion pour la mode et son attachement à la cause ont permis à Oli & Bou de passer de rêve à réalité. Merci Laurence!

 
Vos contributions
Chaque contributeur recevra un crédit d'un montant équivalent à l'option (contrepartie) choisie applicable sur tout achat lorsque la collection sera disponible en ligne.
 
Disponibilité
La première collection d'Oli & Bou sera disponible en ligne au olibou.com à partir de décembre 2016 et ce, partout dans le monde.
 
Merci, merci, mille fois merci!
Nous vous remercions du fond du coeur pour votre soutien...ou pour tout simplement avoir pris le temps de vous rendre au bas de cette page :) Vous méritez ce hashtag : #oliboujusquaubout
 
Risques et défis
La création de cette ligne de vêtements n'est certainement pas une tâche facile. Les obstacles potentiels peuvent se présenter sous la forme de retards de production, bien que nous prendrons tous les moyens nécessaires pour éviter ceux-ci. 
Il est également à noter que les couleurs et les motifs finaux pourront varier lorsque la collection sera disponible en ligne. 
Avec l'aide d'autres parents d'enfants atteints d'achondroplasie, nous avons établi un charte de mesures pour les enfants atteints d'achondroplasie. Nous avons pris grand soin de trouver les tailles optimales pour les âges 1 à 5, mais il peut y avoir des inconnues. Nous nous engageons à mener à bien ce projet malgré tout bien évidemment.

story:
Why do you need funding?

$20,000 is the bare bones required to begin production of the PLW Calabash. This includes the cost to create the mold, minimum order quantities (Calabash bottles, fabric cases/straps, patches), journals, bracelets, packaging, shipping, insurance and IndieGoGo fee's. 

Once we reach $20,000, any additional funding allows us to build our website, tell the story of the epic dude who inspired the Calabash and to continue our mission of doing what we do best: creating gear designed to better your journey.

 

What's the Calabash?

Only one of the most eye catching/unique/remarkable/comfortable and rad water containers of all time! We discovered the inspiration for it while on a wanderlust abroad, being used by a 19 year old kid named Henry.

The PLW Calabash design is based upon the original Calabash, a wearable water container that has been used for hundreds (some reports suggest, even thousands!) of years to carry water. We loved the concept, the story, and the fact that it had been a part of one mans journey for years... so we set out to design an urban friendly version. After many sleepless nights, VOILA! The first PLW Calabash was born.

 

The specs.

Each 'Bash holds 28 fl. oz, and is made from BPA-free, eco-friendly & recyclable, high quality HDPE. Each has a custom screw on/off top and an adjustable and removable case & strap.

Here are some of the things people are saying...

"The Calabash is so sweet! I love it!" -Chris

"It's so comfortable and looks rad!" -Daniel

"I LOVE the way it looks." -Jill

"It has great feng shui!" - Jackie

"I love lamp." -Brick Tamland

 

REWARDS LEVELS

 

FAQ

Any plans of making the Calabash out of stainless steel, aluminum or other material?

Excellent question! We have searched high and low, and have spoken with dozens of expert bottle manufacturers. Due to the unique shape and our high standards to use a durable, non-leeching, eco-friendly (both pre-production AND post use) material, we arrived at the best choice: BPA-free, recyclable, high quality, HDPE. It maintains the perfect shape, preserves water to taste the way it should and keeps the harmful pollutants where they should be... out of your water and the environment.

 

Rad product. Tell me more about Project: Living Well. 

Project: Living Well is a lifestyle/retail brand designed to outfit, inspire and encourage the lifestyle of adventure. 

 

Any plans of selling these in stores?

Sure. We are in the process of establishing distribution outlets for the Journey Pack which the Calabash will be a part of. If you have a store or would like to recommend a store to carry the Journey Pack, email us at sales@projectlivingwell.com

 

How can I join Project: Living Well?

We're so happy you'd ask! We're so fortunate to get this question a lot! We hope to have a page up soon with our openings and internship opportunities, so stop by and visit us soon at www.projectlivingwell.com.

 

 

SPECIAL THANKS

We owe so many people a big thank you for coming together to make this campaign happen:  

Startup America Partnership for partnering with us in this launch!

Ben Peters for making our pixels look pretty. Check his work out here.

Jacob Burrows for your amazing photography-- check out his site here! or check him out on twitter here.

Ali, Bethany, and Mike for being our excellent and beautiful models for the video. You're more than models, you're living proof of what it means to be a part of something bigger than yourselves. It's inspiring. 

Justin Reed at Clear Cut 3D for the epic rapid prototyping-- there is a huge need for more good people like you. Also thank you to Ted and Rachel Alvia at Avail Co. for taking the seemingly impossible and making it possible. And of course, Cindy Johnson for coming through in the clutch as she always does.

story:
Our purpose is to bring you design and quality for the right price. We have been designing watches for more than a decade, and last year we introduced DWISS’ innovative time display system. The system was awarded two times in 2016, and one of the awards was granted at the European Parliament in Brussels. This year we are bringing back this system in one of our two new collections - RS1. The second one has a totally new display system - RC1.

 

We are proud to introduce two large collections of watches produced with the highest degree of Swiss craftsmanship, catering to the desires and needs of every serious watch enthusiast. The collections are called DWISS RC1, a classic looking model with a centralized hour disc at the 12 o'clock mark, and DWISS RS1, a sporty collection that uses the DWISS signature time reading system.

In these collections, we are introducing for the first time in crowdfunding history a highly complicated Swiss-made watch, with the Tourbillon models . Our talking piece and the greatest watch ever presented to crowdfunding.

 

In addition to the Tourbillon models, we also have automatic versions and quartz models. Each and every one is an original Swiss-made, limited edition timepiece, with an exclusive, innovative and award-winning time display system, which has become DWISS’ signature.  

 

 

 

 

One of the most challenging-to-make watch mechanisms, the tourbillon is a complicated movement that makes the escapement turn around its own axis, designed to counter the effects of gravity. By continuously rotating the entire balance wheel/escapement, the tourbillon averages out positional errors. Developed around 1795 and patented in 1801 by master watch-maker Abraham-Louis Breguet, the tourbillon is included in expensive watches made today by the most luxurious and traditional brands and is one of the most valued features for a collector in premium timepieces. The most virtuoso and desirable function in a watch mechanism that would once cost you 5 to 6 figures is offered for the first time in a crowdfunding campaign much much less. 

All our straps are 100% Italian made, respecting Italy’s tradition for leather goods, handcrafted by artisans in an authentic leather workshop. Produced by the same manufacturer that supplies the most renowned Italian luxury brands. Equipped with quick-release pins, the straps are easily interchangeable. 

“Vacchetta”: The cowhide is treated using vegetable tanning, an ancient process that certain tanneries are rediscovering. Vegetable means that metals such as chromium and other environmentally damaging substances are not used to treat the leather. In their place, tanning powders obtained from leaves, fruits, flowers and the roots of plants are used. Giving the skin an incredibly soft touch and the classic scent of leather.

- Pit Stop: The Pit Stop technical fabric is made of PVC. Thanks to its properties it is waterproof and resistant to scratches.

- “Saffiano”: Saffiano printing is made by embossing the typical cross-stitch pattern on the calfskin. After printing, the skin is treated with wax, making it resistant to scratches and giving a soft touch to the material.

Do you want to test the watch before pledging one? You can do so virtually by downloading the free APP, available for android and iOS. You can also make nice wrist shots like ours and be awarded. HAVE FUN!!!

 
 

 

DWISS is a multi award-winning company founded in Switzerland in 2011. The company creates limited-edition Swiss-made timepieces with unique time display systems, selling them for fair prices. We are proud to combine our avant-garde design with the tradition of Swiss watchmaking. 

Last year, with the help of our backers, we created the most innovative Swiss-made watch in crowdfunding history. The timepiece was awarded with the International Design Award, and Gold Award in the luxury category by the European Product Design AwardTM, awarded at a ceremony held at the European Parliament in Brussels.

Todays’ watchword in watchmaking is micro brand. Small-scale brands that are sought after by collectors, connoisseurs and watch lovers in search of uniqueness and value for their money.

Why? The traditional way of selling watches has all but been eliminated by the internet. The highly margined watch industry and the common, standard look of the timepieces; counterfeit watches all over the market; new brands being born every day selling fake luxury items; all these factors have contributed to the crisis in which the luxury watch market finds itself today.

Here some testimonials of our 2016 backers. Sorry for the ones not included, but if we mention all of you, the page will be endless ; ) We took the testimonials randomly. Thank you all for having written to us. Cheers!

  • Mr Zamora: @Rafael and the DWISS team,  Congratulations on receiving this award. It's a recognition of your hard work and creativity. As one of your backers, I am very pleased to own the M2 knowing the quality of the watch and it's award-winning design. For the price we paid for this watch, it's a steal. I hope this award will inspire you to continue to create great watches and will give us the opportunity to be part of your next project. You can always count on my support. Thank you.   
  • Shrink: I can't tell you how much I am enjoying wearing your watch. It is such a remarkable creation.
  • Yuk C. P. : Watch received.... awesome and happy to the max.. are you going to make more? I don't mind owning same one... it is sooooooooo cool and I am wearing it to a gathering tonight... Panerai put to rest while dwiss on my wrist..     
  • Harsh B. : I just received the watch and as expected looks amazing. I think it will really stand out amongst all the other watches in the room in any social gathering. So happy I decided to get this watch.   Thank you for such a great product.     
  • Richard A.: On a more upbeat note, I am thoroughly pleased with this watch. Deciding which watch to wear in the morning has just become 10 times harder now :D  
  • Leonard F says: Hey Dwiss,  I have gotten my watch today. Overall I am very impressed with the watch! The build quality and packaging of the watch is superb not to mention a really friendly and helpful customer service here :) . Besides that this watch is totally a fantastic watch and I will utterly recommend it to all my watch enthusiast friends. Cheers,  Leo  
  • Simon D.: Well.... on my wrist sits a very robust looking Dwiss watch. Beautifully packaged, love the colour (orange) and a very very stunning looking watch! Very pleased - thanks Dwiss. The watch tho.... seriously impressed - I was so nervous about funding the sort of money (always wanted a Tag) and this was the money put away for one... it's going to be hard to not wear it everyday!   
  • Steve B.:  Hi Rafael. My watch arrived today and I have posted it on instagram. The movement is visually stunning and looks just as detailed as the Tag Carrera 16 I have. For those still waiting you will be happy with the details and the finish. The wait is worth it.   
  • Thomas K.: received my watch today, better than my tag heuer .  Boon H.:  Thank you once again and I have to say that I'm a proud owner of Dwiss Emme watch.      
  • Frankie said: Just received my ABO and it's a fantastic watch.   
  • Julien G. said: Eric, that's MINE!!!! Looks absolutely gorgeous.   
  • Daniel said: @Dwiss I just got my watch. Took 3 days to ship which is amazing. The watch looks ten times better in person. Thank you
  •  Shrink: @Rafael, My sincerest congratulations on receiving the award. It is well deserved for the unique and beautiful design of the watch.   
  • Julien G. said: To all future owners of SSW, Guys hold tight, the watch is a perfection!!!! I have 15 watches now, and this one has THE something special that makes it my favourite. Raphael, DWISS team, you rock!!!!!!!!   
  • Chian wei said: Received the watches. IT'S AWESOME !    

 

The campaign video in high resolution:

 

 Video credits: Area2 Visual Media area2media.it vimeo.com/area2

RS1 and RC1 - Automatic specifications LIMITED EDITION 199 WATCHES per color  Case: 45 mm 316L stainless steel  Movement: Swiss made - Automatic movement ETA 2824, 25 jewels Frequency 4Hz – 28’800  Power reserve: approximately 42 h.  Glass (crystal): Sapphire with double anti reflection.  Strap: Italian Made, Waterproof, anti-allergic Italian leather or fabrics.  Buckle: 316L stainless steel.  Water resistance: up to 20ATM, 200 meters.  Watch size: 45,0 mm x 13,05 mm  Case back: Stainless steel with glass opening.  Warranty: 2 years worldwide







RS1 and RC1 - Tourbillon specifications LIMITED EDITION 10 WATCHES per model (10 RS1 and 10 RC1) Case: 45 mm 316L stainless steel Movement: Swiss made - Automatic Tourbillon  CONCEPTO 8950, 27 jewels, Frequency 4Hz – 28’800 Tourbillon at 6 o'clock, one revolution per minute Power reserve: approximately 60 hours. Glass (crystal): Sapphire with double anti reflection coating. Strap: Italian Made, Waterproof, anti-allergic Italian leather or fabric. Buckle: 316L stainless steel. Water resistance: up to 10ATM, 100 meters. Watch size: 45,00 mm x 14,40 mm Case back: Stainless steel with glass opening. Warranty: 2 years worldwide

story:
Link: Kickstarter

We believe that luxury timepieces should be personalized. We offered an exclusive edition for a specific perk to let you custom make the case back with the name or short message for someone special. You can engrave the texts or symbols within ten digits. (Included spacing)

Remarks: You can select the Super Early Bird Pack for this exclusive edition. We will send you an email to collect your information when the campaign conclusion.

 

 

 

At this period, we received many requests from the backers to ask for the sapphire crystal. The original is hardened crystal with sapphire coating. We think that each of the contributors should have their right to make the final decision. Therefore,  we want to offer each of you the optional sapphire crystal option and let you make your own decision.

For those who are interested in upgrade the watch crystal, please select the sapphire crystal upgrade pack of USD 39.

 

 

Links: ABlogToWatch, MENCLUB

 

LENVINO is inspired by Legend, Tradition and Innovation. We strive to create legendary timepieces by combining traditional craftsmanship and innovative design.

 

 

 

We are a group of watch-addicts who have already worked in the Hong Kong watch industry for over 28 years. We specialized in the design and manufacturing of high quality quartz and automatic watches.We have established good relationships with the world’s leading watch manufacturers specializing in luxury watches for high-end brands that retail for over US$1,000, as well as renowned watch companies in the retail market with over 400 chain stores world-wide.  

 

 

Our ambition is to create our very own brand, which we can share with watch enthusiasts around the globe. Through “LENVINO”, we are offering high-quality products with unique and exclusive designs comparable to watches at department stores and luxury brands, but at only a fraction of their retail price.

 

We want to share our love for watches with you. But in order to do that, we need more than just having innovative and tradition designs, quality support from a world leading manufacturing partner, and 28 years of industry experience. Your support will be instrumental in helping us achieve our dream, and we are confident you will be impressed with the design, workmanship and value that our watches offer.

 

In recent years, the release of smartwatches has had a large impact on the traditional watches market. They serve customers with additional functions and act as a wearable computer; however, for those who are watch-addicts, they would only concern about the watch’s fine craftsmanship, aesthetic and its primary function to tell the time. We would like to awaken people’s mind about the core function of a watch, thus create the brand LENVINO.

Inspired by the confrontation between smartwatches and traditional watches, LENVINO Tour collection offers the best of both worlds. The time-tested hand-winding Tourbillon movement at its core, coupled with modern traditional designs with well-proportioned cases inspired by the signature smartwatch.

 

Initially, LENVINO Tour collection will offer you 6 color combinations to choose. All watches are equipped with a hand-winding Tourbillon movement.

 

TOUR Grey & Silver. Dark grey dial with applied rose gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished silver tone. Light brown Italian calf leather strap with white stitching.

 

TOUR Silver & Gold. Silver dial with applied gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in black across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished light yellow gold tone. Blue Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching

 

TOUR Wood & Black. 3D printed wood pattern dial with applied gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in matte black tone. Black Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching.

 

TOUR Blue & Silver. Navy blue dial with applied rose gold tone-plated indices at 12, 3 and 9 o’clock positions, silver tone hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished silver tone. Brown Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching

 

TOUR Gradient Black. Gradient Black dial with applied silver tone indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in brushed silver tone. Black Italian calf leather strap with white stitching.

 

TOUR Gradient Brown. Gradient Brown dial with applied rose gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished light rose gold tone. Dark Grey Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching.

 

 

 

 

Inspired by the modern smartwatch, the LENVINO sports a rectangular case with rounded edges. The case is enclosed by a dome crystal on the front and a screw-down transparent caseback from the rear, allowing you to enjoy every movement of the Tourbillon.

Viewed from the side, the dome crystal joins the case back flawlessly through a smooth curved surface. The streamlined case is more than just an elegant design feature – it also allows for a slimmer profile. 

The metal parts are made from 316L stainless steel, which translates to greater corrosion resistance and durability in high temperatures.

 

Inspired by a minimalistic design, we stripped away all unnecessary elements from the dial, focusing exclusively on the Flying Tourbillon. The base of the dial is decorated with fine vertical lines / 3D wooden printed (Tour Wood & Black), giving it a brushed metal pattern effect / natural wood effect (Tour Wood & Back). The indices are kept to a minimal: numbered indices are displayed at 12, 3, and 9 o’clock positions, with the remaining indices baton-shaped.  

Time is displayed by the Dauphine-style hands, which are tapered diamond-shape and faceted at the center. Aptly named, the hands are stylistically the most traditional, bearing a regal history and link to the King of France. 

The Flying Tourbillon can be found at the bottom of the dial and is surrounded by a brightness and sharpness diamond-like cutting edge.

 

Our interchangeable watch straps are made from genuine Italian calf leather and come with polished 316L stainless steel buckles engraved with our brand name “LENVINO”. The straps have a width of 20mm x 18mm, a unisex functional length suitable for most customers, and 9 holes for adjustment.  

They are available in six different colors and designs: (1) Light Brown with white stitching, (2) Brown with tone on tone stitching, (3) Black with white stitching, (4) Blue with tone on tone stitching (5) Dark grey with tone on tone stitching and (6) Black with tone-on-tone stitching 

 

We believe that luxury timepieces should be exclusive and unique. Therefore, the first 100 pieces of each design will be Limited Edition and individually numbered. The watches will come engraved with “LIMITED EDITION” and “XXX/100” wording on the caseback and be accompanied by a certification card.

 

Remarks: Please note that your Backer number may not correspond to the watch number you will receive, since some backers before you may have purchased multiple watches and the previous backers from Kickstarter.

We will confirm your unique number with you once the campaign has finished. LENVINO Tour collection each colors produced after the first 100pcs will not be individually numbered or considered Limited Edition.

 

We believe that a high quality, exclusive, well-designed watch should come in premium packaging. You will feel satisfied when you receive your watch.

 

 

1. Decide the “perk” you want to go for. Click the pink button that says, "GET THIS PERK."

2. Fill out your shipping information and continue with your payment.

3. Once the campaign is over, you will receive an email to choose your watch color, strap color,    limited edition number or request of information for the exclusive edition. After we had received your information, we will start production.

**If we don’t reach our funding goal, you will receive your money back. 5-7 days after the campaign ends.

 

We will ship the watches worldwide. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable in your region.

 

We expect to ship the watches from June 2018. While we will make every effort to ship your orders on time, we ask for your understanding that slight delays in production may be possible. We will keep you informed of any changes as they arise.

 

All of our watches will come with a 1-year international warranty. The warranty will cover all parts against manufacturer defects, for which the watch will be repaired or exchanged free of charge.

  •  Keep your watch wound - Winding keeps the watch working, spreads the lubricants and the accuracy should be best with a fully wound watch.  
  • Please avoid any Bumps and Shocks - Shocks can damage any watch mechanism, scratches to the case or break the mirror. Remember your watch is a real “Tourbillon” consisted of more than hundreds tiny parts.     
  • Cleaning  - If your watch has become dirty, the best way to clean it is with a soft damp cloth.    
  • 3ATM Water Resistance - Swimming, diving, showering, bathing, taking a jacuzzi or sauna, or any submersion in water whilst wearing your watch should be avoided 

 

Please feel free to contact us at (info@lenvinowatch.com). We will always be here to answer any questions you may have.

Risks and challenges

Although we are new on Indiegogo and Kickstarter, we have over 28 years of solid experience in the watchmaking industry. We are aware that our project is complex and that there are always unforeseen issues. However, we are confident that our professional manufacturing partners can help us minimize the potential risks by deploying strict quality controls during the manufacturing process.

Our manufacturers stand ready to begin production as soon as we meet our funding goal. Including the time needed to acquire the necessary parts, assemble the watches and perform all necessary checks, we anticipate that the first batch of orders will be delivered to you in about 3 months’ time from start of production. We will, of course, keep you updated on our progress throughout. 


Thank you to everyone who has supported the project from the start and to all our backers.
story_txt:
Link: KickstarterWe believe that luxury timepieces should be personalized. We offered an exclusive edition for a specific perk to let you custom make the case back with the name or short message for someone special. You can engrave the texts or symbols within ten digits. (Included spacing)Remarks: You can select the Super Early Bird Pack for this exclusive edition. We will send you an email to collect your information when the campaign conclusion.   At this period, we received many requests from the backers to ask for the sapphire crystal. The original is hardened crystal with sapphire coating. We think that each of the contributors should have their right to make the final decision. Therefore,  we want to offer each of you the optional sapphire crystal option and let you make your own decision.For those who are interested in upgrade the watch crystal, please select the sapphire crystal upgrade pack of USD 39.  Links: ABlogToWatch, MENCLUB LENVINO is inspired by Legend, Tradition and Innovation. We strive to create legendary timepieces by combining traditional craftsmanship and innovative design.   We are a group of watch-addicts who have already worked in the Hong Kong watch industry for over 28 years. We specialized in the design and manufacturing of high quality quartz and automatic watches.We have established good relationships with the world’s leading watch manufacturers specializing in luxury watches for high-end brands that retail for over US$1,000, as well as renowned watch companies in the retail market with over 400 chain stores world-wide.    Our ambition is to create our very own brand, which we can share with watch enthusiasts around the globe. Through “LENVINO”, we are offering high-quality products with unique and exclusive designs comparable to watches at department stores and luxury brands, but at only a fraction of their retail price. We want to share our love for watches with you. But in order to do that, we need more than just having innovative and tradition designs, quality support from a world leading manufacturing partner, and 28 years of industry experience. Your support will be instrumental in helping us achieve our dream, and we are confident you will be impressed with the design, workmanship and value that our watches offer. In recent years, the release of smartwatches has had a large impact on the traditional watches market. They serve customers with additional functions and act as a wearable computer; however, for those who are watch-addicts, they would only concern about the watch’s fine craftsmanship, aesthetic and its primary function to tell the time. We would like to awaken people’s mind about the core function of a watch, thus create the brand LENVINO.Inspired by the confrontation between smartwatches and traditional watches, LENVINO Tour collection offers the best of both worlds. The time-tested hand-winding Tourbillon movement at its core, coupled with modern traditional designs with well-proportioned cases inspired by the signature smartwatch. Initially, LENVINO Tour collection will offer you 6 color combinations to choose. All watches are equipped with a hand-winding Tourbillon movement. TOUR Grey & Silver. Dark grey dial with applied rose gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished silver tone. Light brown Italian calf leather strap with white stitching. TOUR Silver & Gold. Silver dial with applied gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in black across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished light yellow gold tone. Blue Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching TOUR Wood & Black. 3D printed wood pattern dial with applied gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in matte black tone. Black Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching. TOUR Blue & Silver. Navy blue dial with applied rose gold tone-plated indices at 12, 3 and 9 o’clock positions, silver tone hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished silver tone. Brown Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching TOUR Gradient Black. Gradient Black dial with applied silver tone indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in brushed silver tone. Black Italian calf leather strap with white stitching. TOUR Gradient Brown. Gradient Brown dial with applied rose gold tone-plated indices and hands, and "Tourbillon" printed in white across the bottom of the dial. Rectangular case with rounded edges in polished light rose gold tone. Dark Grey Italian calf leather strap with tone-on-tone stitching.    Inspired by the modern smartwatch, the LENVINO sports a rectangular case with rounded edges. The case is enclosed by a dome crystal on the front and a screw-down transparent caseback from the rear, allowing you to enjoy every movement of the Tourbillon.Viewed from the side, the dome crystal joins the case back flawlessly through a smooth curved surface. story:
Our Story

My business, Blasphemina's Closet, started as commission-based in 2000, then became a brand that made custom-sized items I designed for people into the subculture style called Lolita (http://lolitafashion.org/). In the evolution of my brand I’ve started making more ready to wear clothing that involve my decadent aesthetic and my goal in making everyone feel like the most beautiful or handsome person in the room without the subculture box.  I have never applied for business loans or grants until now.  As BC has grown I have realized that in order to move forward and become what it needs to be, I need to treat it as a startup since I'm moving in a new, different and exciting direction.  


Designer Bio:

Samantha Rei pulls inspirations stemming from historical fashion, fairytales and Japanese youth fashion. Debuting her line Blasphemina’s Closet in 2000, she makes one-of-a-kind pieces, custom projects, wedding gowns and high-end items. Currently she is working on a ready-to-wear line that encourages elegance, innocence and comfort.
Samantha draws her inspiration from such illustrators and Chris Riddell, Brom, Tony DiTerlizzi, Brett Helquist and Mihara Mitsukazu as well as stories like Alice in Wonderland and Snow White. Her hero Alexander McQueen as well as designers Vivienne Westwood, H. Naoto, John Galliano, Colleen Atwood, and Victorian Maiden have influenced her style. 
To date Samantha has been part of several runway shows both solo and with other artists, has run the Schoolgirls and Mobilesuits (“SGMS”) fashion show since 2006. She has also been featured or shown in magazines such as Shojo Beat, Minnesota Women’s Press, Five For Magazine, Pacific Rim Magazine, Runway, RX magazine, Vita.mn, City Pages, Ouch Magazine, Minnesota Public Radio, Gothic Beauty, Showcase Minnesota, and the American Gothic and Lolita Bible.
In 1998, Samm began attending the Perpich Center for Arts Education in Golden Valley, Minnesota, choosing to focus on her skills as an illustrator and painter. After graduating in 1999, she spent a year at the College of Visual Arts (CoVA) in Saint Paul to major in illustration then continued her education at the Minneapolis Community and Technical College for Apparel Technologies.
“I want people to feel what I feel when the girls wear these clothes. I want them to see how they own the look and become the person the dress was made for. I want the men to feel powerful and handsome,” she said.


The Impact

My favorite thing about running a clothing business is making people feel special and beautiful.  While beauty is not a necessity per se, feeling good about oneself is.  In order to get through the day to day rigors, having actual high self esteem, not putting on airs and acting as though you do, is helpful.  Everyone of every age, race, gender and size should be able to feel like a prince or princess.  


I have been in business for eleven years and it has become quite clear that I have focused all of my energy and time on this one thing.  If BC doesn't continue to grow I will have to take several steps back and start all over.  This isn't just a dream that a spooky kid from a small town had 12 years ago anymore.  This is an actual business that not only affect myself, it affects my family, friends, clients, and fans.  If I can pick up steam I can hire employees, which creates jobs, which helps the economy.  If the in-take continues to go up I can afford insurance  so that when I start my family in the next couple of years I can take care of them without any outside help.  I can do even more in my charity work.


It's not only about being self sufficient and staying afloat, it's about contributing to society in a positive way.  


What We Need & What You Get

In the next year I’m going to work towards going into production. Initially I will be presenting my fall collection at shows in Atlanta, then in Madison and Minneapolis. The first goal is transporting my work space outside of my home, the second is creating my fall collection.


As a small business owner I have to rely on the resources I have. Currently I work from home with a few interns. As money comes in it goes right back into the projects. This project would be the way for me to get ahead of the project and keep a continuous flow of work going instead of stopping when the hard spots come.

I live in north Minneapolis, an area affected by a huge tornado earlier this summer.  My studio was flooded and I lost about $500-600 in materials and finished product.  The basement has since been repaired, which took a huge bite out of my finances.  Recently my car's transmission also gave out.  My husband will be going to college 3 hours away for the next two years so I will be the primary earner in the house. Once he leaves I will be renting out my home studio to make ends meet and move my work space outside of the house to up productivity.


My F/W 2011 collection, "Atlantis Kumarinadu", is inspired by water, Korean and Chinese garments, organic looking fabrics, Belle Epoque and Art Nouveau style and Ozma from the Oz books.  It will be an intricate and sumptuous collection full of decadent details and fairytale styling.


Immediate Goal (~5000):

Getting a small studio (prepay the first 6 months)
Raise materials cost for F/W 2011 “Atlantis Kumarinadu”

•           fabrics (batiks, sari fabric, cotton, silk, etc)

•           trims

•           accessories materials

Build larger cutting table and shelves.


Secondary Goals (~2500):

Get an industrial sewing machine
Get new plus sized mannequin and professional fit size mannequin

Replenish materials lost in the flooding

 

As a reward for believing in my fancy vision, I will give goodies to backers.

Rewards:
$5 – Thank you Tweet

$15 – Look Book

$50 – Look Book, Thank you in the Look Book and on the website, BC Button pack

$75 – Look Book, Thank you in the Look Book and on the website, handmade kanzashi brooch made from the fabric from the collection, BC Button pack

$100 – Look Book, Thank you in the Look Book and on the website, handmade kanzashi brooch made from the fabric from the collection, BC Button packfree admission to the Full Fashion Panic Show

$200 – Look Book, Thank you in the Look Book and on the website, handmade kanzashi brooch made from the fabric from the collection, garment from this collection named after you (gender specific, so if you are male, your choice of lady’s name), BC Button pack, free admission to the Full Fashion Panic Show

$500 – Handwritten thank you card, Thank you in the Look Book and on the website, handmade kanzashi brooch and Alice band made from the fabric from the collection, garment from this collection named after you (gender specific, so if you are male, your choice of lady’s name), BC Button pack, free admission to the Full Fashion Panic Show, framed print of your favorite garment from the collection signed by the designer and my eternal gratitude!


Donation gifts will be sent out after the campaign ends.  Certain items such as looks books and tickets to SGMS will be sent out separately.  Thank yous on Twitter can be followed by the hashtag #fancinesslives.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am a lucky designer.  I have a large network of family, friends and fans who i love very much.  Even if you personally can't help, please pass on the word to your fancy friends, your colleagues who love contributing to small business and your community.

Links:
Look Book from S/S 2011 - http://www.flickr.com/photos/29770333@N06/sets/72157626890178198/
BC Press Page - http://www.blaspheminascloset.com/press/
Schoolgirls and Mobilesuits (Full Fashion Panic) - http://schoolgirlsandmobilesuits.com/
