We run a 6 month test period with our young professionals as business development interns, asking them to connect us to a self formed group of female artisans, and help us bring them to scale in an international product market through developing their design, quality control and timetables to our standards.

We have done this effectively for over a year, and are currently looking to put two more professionals into our intern process. We’ve developed a line of paper beads this way, and are looking to do it with three more product lines this year.
We currently empower approximately 12 women to provide for their families, and provide supplemental income to dozens of others. We are looking to quadruple our impact in 2013.
I have been given a small business loan to expand our impact through our partnership with individual artisans in Uganda and will be leaving on July 17th to expand our product lines and, with that expansion, our work to increase the financial independence of our partners.
Over the next four weeks I will:

Meet directly with the artisans we work with to share a small business development curriculum I have developed with my entrepreneur coach.

Take and develop new Nakate designs created by a designer exclusively for Nakate. Through the development of these designs, I wil teach our artisans to implement simple systems of quality control, production timing, consistency and design patterns.

Buy new stock from these artisans to sell to our wholesalers and in our online store, directly affecting their ability to pay their bills and provide for their families through creative means, rather than back breaking labor or participation in the local sex industry.

Grow our impact through working with an increased number of artisans through expanding our lines into more cow horn pieces and hand made bags. 

Network with more professionals and entrepreneurs in Kampala to expand our management team on the ground.
In order to fully reach our impact goal, I am raising $1,000 more toward my work on the ground this summer. Your contribution to our work will be directly invested into purchasing stock from the women we work with, directly improving their financial, physical and emotional well being and assisting me in creating a larger impact on the lives of our partners through empowerment and business rather than a hand out.
Alternatively, you can shop our online store, currently 40% off with the code NEWSTOCK: http://www.nakateproject.com/store/shop-our-col....

story:
Wear Vegas Sunglasses and take a look at the world: there is someone who needs you!

From you backer to american’s Children: join our cause and help them.

Do you know  ICAF - The International Child Art Foundation? It is a non profit organization whose objectives are to cultivate children’s imagination, reduce violence, and remediate suffering. The ICAF fosters children’s creativity and develops their empathy arranging exhibitions across the U.S. and around the world.

We chose to donate to ICAF some of the money collected on Indiegogo because we believe that children's creativity is a valuable asset that must be preserved. You can see our special ICAF Sunglasses made with children drawing all around the world. 

We are really happy to share with you an abstract of  ICAF’S  Manifesto of Child Artists:

 

“Believe in what you think, see, imagine and feel.

Use your imagination and look at the world.

Be looking for ideas all the time, anywhere you go.

Look at the world with an open mind.

…

You can be creative but it takes hard work.

Put your mind to whatever you want to do.

Keep practicing.

Set goals; research your thoughts; use your brain.”

 

We share these thoughts. Don’t you?

 

Our aim is to market a quality product at a reasonable price, breaking the laws dictated by big names of  the fashion eyewear and at the same time giving a contribution to preserve children’s creativity.

What about Vegas Sunglasses?

Vegas are colored and extravagant sunglasses characterized by a unique composition of images taken from our collections: each pair follows a topic, each pair transmits emotion.

Vagas Sunglasses come from the idea that the accessory makes the difference: it has to convey our attitude, to represent our mood, give off our feelings so, when we define our look we should find the inner meaning of what we wear.  

Vegas Sunglasses is a high quality, made in Italy, trendy product  that, despite of the handmade process of creating, keeps an affordable price.

                                                               

                   Wouldn’t be fun to collect them all in order to change your sunglasses            

                                            according to your mood?

From Usa to Italy..The story so far…

We are a group of friends, guys and girls, collectors of vinyl, comics, fashion newspaper clippings, vintage postcard. We always knew that we would have done something with this material .. but what?

One day we thought << why not share our collection, giving the opportunity to those who want to own a little piece of it ?>>

A year ago we went to Italy to visite a dear friend, head of a little workshop in Venice in which he produces beautiful hand made decorated eyeglasses.
We were impressed by that unique team of skilled artisans, working hard and carrying out their work with passion and accuracy in order to create truly unique pieces and we thought that we’d liked to work with them.
Our idea was born from this meeting: properly combining all our clippings it’s possible to synthesize a concept, express a passion for a particular art movement or a musical trend, so we thought that all this could be conveyed not only, as usual, in a common t-shirt, but in a pair of sunglasses.

We think that the experience and technique are essential to ensure the quality of a pair of sunglasses, so we explained our idea to our friends from Venice and his team that appear immediately enthusiastic about the idea. Even though an ocean separates us, I can safely say that we are a team of people, each of us with their skills, that cooperate and face daily to improve the quality of the product using only eco-friendly materials.

 

The process of creating

The process of creating of each pair of glasses includes a careful analysis of the repertoire of available images, a continuous research of new sources and a detailed assemblage, following  color and theme’s criteria. After many attempts,  using the best printing and fixing techniques, we have found an almost craftsmanship production process that allows us to obtain an high quality product. The images are chosen one by one with care, put together with skill and knowledge to create a jigsaw portraying our passions, our feelings.

Lenses

Vegas lenses are made from multiple thermally fused polycarbonate layers. The center layer contains a polarized film to cut glare from reflective surfaces and water. The lenses contrast and blocks 100% of all UVA, UVB and UV400 ultraviolet rays.

 

Rewards

As you can imagine, the manufacturing process is quite long time and it is difficult for now to  bear all costs to find a production process that allows us to market the product. That's why we need your help. 

We want to make our final product PERFECT, better than the prototypes in the video. We want  to be able to start a production system that allows us to market Vegas sunglasses at a reasonable price. As you can imagine taking a product from prototype to large volumes always involves complexity. Vegas sunglasses needs to be 100% perfect, or it just isn't good enough to ship to you. To make this possible we have to invest heavily in the production process and control the timing. Our goal is to offer a product of superior quality at a reasonable price, in order to do this is necessary to observe carefully all the various steps of our plan in which you have the most important role.

We ask you to join our cause backing us or spreading the word… we will thank you with deeds not words!! 

                              

                  

FAQ

When will my sunglasses arrive?

Your Vegas sunglasses will arrive as soon as the first production ended, approximately in the month of February-March.

Is it possible to pick which colors/designs I want?

Sure! Email us which model you choose among  ROCK, FUNKY, MANGA, CINEMA, SURF, POPART, ART, 

How do I know if the size is right?

Vegas Sunglasses are available in two sizes: small and medium, choose the one that's right for you!

Questions/comments? Please email us!! (vegas.sunglasses@gmail.com)

story:
The Story

In January, myself and 3 friends will be taking part in a 3-wheeled motorized gong-show spanning 3500KM down the west coast of India. We are doing this for the thrill of life-endagering adventure ... and for 2 charities called FRANKwater & Water for People. The event is called The Rickshaw Run and it's organized by the good people at The Adventurists.

The Impact

If you pre-order a shirt:
FRANKwater will get to bring clean drinking water to those in need.
You will get a t-shirt to remember us by when we drive off a cliff into The Arabian Sea. Win-Win.

The Shirts

The shirts will be printed on super soft American Apparel Unisex 50/50 tees.
The more shirts we print, the cheaper it is to print em... which means more dollars for charity... So spread the word! 
- SHIRT SIZE AND DELIVERY WILL BE CONFIRMED AFTER FUNDRAISING. 
- ADDITIONAL SHIPPING WILL APPLY FOR ORDERS OUTSIDE OF CANADA.


Don't like T-shirts? Donate Direct!

No problemo. You can donate directly by clicking on the links BELOW.
Heck, you can even get a tax receipt if your Canadian, you shirtless weirdo.
Make sure you donate THROUGH THE LINKS BELOW and not through INDIEGOGO for this option.
FRANKwater (UK Charity)
The Official Rickshaw Run Charity

WATER FOR PEOPLE (Canadian Charity)
We chose this additional charity because it is tax deductable for Canadians

story:
Beauty is Pain, No Longer...

Ask any woman you know, wearing necklaces with long hair can be a *PAIN IN THE NECK*. Some women have come up with their own ways of dealing with this but until now there has never been a product designed to specifically tackle this problem. In 2005 I was disucssing this problem with my friend when the idea struck me. If we are all having this problem, lets find a solution... Life happened and the idea sat in the cobwebs of my brain for years. In 2010 after losing my job as a bank teller, I was ready to begin the journey of sharing my idea with the world. The process started with me making protoypes with a variety of materials and designs.

 

Very quickly I realized I needed help and Kevin, an engineer friend, held my hand and together we refined the design to what it is today. It has now been two years of designing, testing, & redesigning. 

 

Up to this point Calipz has been completely self funded. I've poured my life's saving, imposed on friends and family for investments, and called in every last favor. It's a win-win by helping one woman (that's me) and solves a problem for all women. We're not curing cancer here but this seeminly small problem carries some big burdens. Some necklace clasps are more violent offenders than others but no matter how much hair they claim the results are always the same: painful, hair splitting, and heartbreaking. You want to wear that gorgeous necklace that your boyfriend got you but EVERY time you wear it you're ripping hair out. Grandma gave you her beautiful pendant necklace but from all the times you've pulled hair out the clasp is broken.

 

All In

 I've spent the last two years on a crash course in manufacturing, design, and distribution. Join me in this journey and help your sisters, mothers, wives, and yourselves keep those necklaces in check.

Your contributions will be used to produce our first mass production and packaging. Calipz - Necklasps are made using injection molding; take a large steel (custom) mold, inject silicone into hundreds of cavities, and Voila! Calipz is born.

Production:

  • $5,000: tooling (big steel mold)
  • $2,500: labor and materials
  • $3,700: packaging and custom design (3-packs + shipper of six 3-packs) 
  • $800: operating expenses such as shipping and marketing

If the goal is not met you'll still get your Calipz. It may be a prototype (not one of my shrink wrap prortypes - dont worry) and it may arrive in a ziploce bag (not really) but you'll have a unique part of our history. 

 

Your Neck's Best Friend

This may seems like a small problem to some but if you've ever felt that stabbing pinch from a hair tangled clasp or spent countless hours prying your poor defenseless hair out of a necklace then you'll appreciate what Calipz can do for you.

For the men reading this think of the painstaking effort that you spend picking out just the right necklace to give the woman in your life. You dont's want that time spent in vain. Make sure she can and will wear it without worrying.

Be the first to get in on this emerging trend! We plan to offer silver and gold, glitter, colors, and differnet sizes in the near future. You'll be the first to never again have your hair eaten by your necklace. Guys, be the knight in shingin armor to give the gift of worry free accessories.

Run and tell that...

Spread the word! Share it on facebook, twitter, pinterest, every little bit counts. Tell your friends, family, and you to please help spread the word.

story:
About Us

The REVEER team is composed of undergraduate students from the University of Ottawa and we are committed to providing accessories that are ethically made and environmentally friendly. As students and young professionals, we were tired of regularly purchasing an average backpack!  So we came together to create a unique backpack that can be used by the everyday student and young professional.  The REVEER backpack is minimalistic yet stylishly functional!

REVEER bags are unique in that they are durable, handmade, ethically sourced, recycled and locally sourced.

  • Durable because jute has high tensile strength - enough to carry up to 150 pounds of coffee beans!

  • Each bag is handmade by talented artisans who take considerable attention to detail, creativity, and care to ensure that it is constructed to last.

  • It is ethically sourced as Canadian immigrant women are employed to make these wonderful bags.

  • Our bags are made with recycled fabrics, which decreases textile waste in Canada.

  • Finally, they are locally sourced as all manufacturing and fabrics used for the bags are found at home, in Canada.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to fund and ensure the sustainability of this project, our team needs to raise at least $3000. This money will go towards:

  • building our inventory,
  • creating new product lines,
  • and giving more women employment opportunities for a fair and liveable wage.
If we exceed our goal, this will allow us to employ more women, introduce more product lines, and ultimately collaborate with various organizations in order to find further opportunities for empowerment. 

Perks

We've made giving a bit easier for you! Here are five different options to choose from that come as perks when making contributions:

If we do not reach our entire funding goal, the amount raised will continue to go towards producing the backpacks.

The Impact

Our two primary goals are: 

1) To empower women by creating valuable work experience and providing resources for career advancement.

2) To divert as much textile waste away from landfills as we possibly can! 

Since our whole team comes from families who have immigrated or took refuge in Canada, we wanted to find a way to help these newcomers through our product. We have all grown to love this country, but we have noticed a substantial growing issue: the unemployment rate for newcomers and lack of opportunities for immigrant and refugee women in the Canadian workforce.

REVEER gives these women the opportunity to obtain employable skills and credentials for future development through our online boutique, which is dedicated to hiring unemployed and marginalized immigrant and refugee women to work and acquire skills in the textile and fashion industry. One of our many goals is to ensure these women earn and maintain a sustainable income, living wage, and increase their skills for future employment.

We also wanted to tackle textile waste! 

Our bags are made using recycled coffee bags from local coffee roasters, and as a result- no two REVEER backpacks are exactly the same! 

 

Once we are established in Ottawa, we hope to reach out to other organizations nation-wide in order to help provide additional employment opportunities to empower women, and find additional ways to divert textile waste. 

Special thanks to the Walmart Foundation for their financial contribution that helped us launch our initiative!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, you can still help us get the word out! Help us make some noise for our campaign and share our story!

Find us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr and visit our website! 

Campaign Updates

  • 23/03/2016 - REVEER has now reached our $3000 goal in only 19 days – but we're not done yet. Continued support will allow us to collaborate with various organizations to discover additional areas for empowerment and increasing sustainability within Canada!
  • 24/03/2016 - We've reached our goal, now what? Check out this campaign update video for more information: 
      

  • 14/04/2016 - With over 125% of our campaign funded, we are all further encouraging the movement towards a more eco-friendly and empowering way to do business in Canada. Buy your bag by April 15, 2016 to get no-tax and free shipping!

story:
Friends, My name is Rupa and I’m an 21 year old entrepreneur working with StopAcid Attacks campaign. Since last year I've slowly started to venture more into clothing design while dabbling in my artistry talents. At the moment I'm delved in the process of creating my biggest and excitedly awaited first full featured collection to be aimed at SnapDeal.Com. I am setting up a store on SnapDeal and I am expecting that this way I will be able to get more customers who believe in my work and judge me on the basis of merits not on my outlook. Also, my work will get better attention and market as Online clothes shopping is a good alternative to actually going into the department store. 

At present I run my boutique at SheRoes Hangout in Agra, India where I happily work with my fellow acid attack survivors friends. This could happen because you have supported me in raising more than 25000 USD (see the campaign) and I started learning fashion designing under the mentorship of one of the campaigner of SAA, Atul. At present I stay in Chhanv and sell my designs at SheRoes. This was the first time I have presented my clothes and I am glad to see them being appreciated. Many of my dresses are being loved by the tourists who come to India on a visit Taj Mahal. The increase in demand for my creations at SheRoes is expanding my business in to the commercial market space. Friends who visit us in Agra want to be able to buy products the same day and are not prepared to wait for a long period of time even for a piece of bespoke wear. I continue to receive numerous emails asking for my stockiest and how people can purchase my garments online. I want to fulfill the demand for my product and let the customer access the designs with ease.

 

I've started up this crowd funding campaign in the hopes to help achieve the completion of my first full collection on my own store & also on India’s biggest online store SnapDeal.com. 

At the moment I'm delved in the process of creating my biggest and excitedly awaited first full featured collection to be aimed at SnapDeal.Com. I am setting up an online store and reselling at SnapDeal. I am expecting that this way I will be able to acquire more customers who believe in my work and judge me on the basis of competence not on my outward appearance. Also, my work will get better visibility and market as Online clothes shopping is a good alternative to actually going into the department store. 

Why an Online Store is the need of hour?

Using the Internet as my primary sales channel offers multiple advantages.

1) By going online, suddenly an Agra cafe or a small boutique inside that cafe expands its reach to a national, or even international base of potential buyers. During my last Indiegogo campaign, I realized that web-based sales know no international boundaries.

2) Building a website is cheaper than opening a store, and I can reach customers online anywhere in the world. 

3) Shopping is easy and comfortable for customers who can not go to Agra.

4) It's a social world out there, with friends turning to social media such as Facebook and Twitter to connect with the cause and the community work by our campaigners. Even, we know each other on social media/internet) and the only way to connect with friends like you is ‘having online presence’. My Online store will also give you the chance to browse for diverse designs at the same time, providing you with my wide range of designs to select from.

5) There are recommendation features on Internet clothes shops and I am hopeful that I will receive more recommendations online. 

MY STORY

Hi! My name is Rupa, and I’m an 21-year-old acid attack survivor, now turning into an entrepreneur. For me, a dream to be a designer seemed far-fetched at one time. But Instead of hiding my scarred face behind a scarf, I go public and started living for my dream: a fashion designer. I always hung onto my dream but I never knew that one day it would be possible and I would be launching my own label. As a child I wanted to design clothes for young Indian woman, but by the acid attack I was unsure and lost my courage. 

I was 15, when my stepmother, who was unwilling to pay my marriage expenses, entered the bedroom at night. While I slept she poured acid over my face. The wedding was called off. My father refused to let me provide medical, if I would ever advert his new wife. But I however took the bold step and went to the police. My uncle supported me. My stepmother spent only 18 months in jail & now she is free on parole. The contact to my father was aborted.

For six years, I am fighting against pain and social exclusion. So far I had to go through more than 10 surgical operations. Immediately after the attack I moved from my home village to my uncles place in NCR (National Capital Region) and lived in a new family. At present I am a team member of Chhanv Foundation and staying at Chhanv in Agra. Together with the team of “Stop acid attacks” I works for hundreds of other survivors in India.

I am not alone with horror injuries. Exact figures for India do not exist, because acid attacks, earlier, were not punishable as a separate offense. With acid mostly young girls or women are mutilated and disfigured. Some victims go blind or acid etched up through the bone – with deadly consequences. Reasons for the mutilation are jealousy, insults or revenge. There are already numerous cases of young women, who rejected a marriage proposal and being then mutilated from the man!



I created SheRoes Collection as a safe haven to escape to when everyone in the world seemed to have abandoned me. It was there where I sort comfort in creations from my own imagination to give purpose and make sense of the darkness that had unforgivably fallen upon my mental state of wellbeing. Eventually attacked in my teen age and plagued with numerous emotional breakdowns, my confidence was completely lost. I was subjected to harsh cruelty that left me in a very dark place. It was only then at my lowest point when I started searching for a hope in my life. I met some great people who have faced similar violences against them and, later, they have become my inspiration. 

Apart from showing off the clothes, I want to change the way people perceive beauty (Like this experiment). By creating this collection and unleashing it upon the world, it will allow me to lay bare my scars and release all the hatred that has shrouded my life for so long, turning something truly ugly into a work of beautiful artistic expression. I want to tell people to look beyond the surface, to tell them that beauty is really within a person. I’m hoping you’ll help me spread the word about how we can change the world through fashion with these really cool dresses I designed!

First time in India's history when acid attack survivors were the show models & show stoppers modeling for my designs

SheRoes Hangout 

The Sheroes’ Hangout in Agra, a unique Crowd Funded concept initiated by the SAA campaigners, is a heartwarming story of the significant transformation that is taking place in the lives of these young girls and those responsible for putting it together.

Rupa, Ritu, Neetu., Geeta and Dolly. Five acid attack survivors, five incredible stories of lives shattered, but refusing to break. Of unimaginable pain and an indomitable spirit. All five are proud workers at Sheroes’ Hangout in Agra, the labour of love and commitment of a campaign that has a sole motive: Stop Acid Attacks.

At Sheroes, the ideas of beauty and importance of appearance are often the talking point. There is a readers’ cafe, an activism workshop, a designer boutique and an exhibit space, where works crafted by survivors are displayed. The cafe serves food and beverages, but the menu card has no price list. You pay as much as you want.

Why I need you support? 

I find it a bit important asking for help because I know that my project won't be as successful without it. We have gone through our plans and 3000 USD will help with buying the first round of fabric, buy labels, few machines,  get some of the dresses and accessories made). The money we are raising will help cover our production costs, material costs, travel costs, website set-up costs, design work, marketing, and sales costs. 

One of the major issues I’m facing at the moment is time, being able to clear time to make the designs for this collection and giving time for collaborators to craft selected components that I may not otherwise be able to do myself. As I am only one self-employed person who runs my whole business 24/7 I have to stretch out to keep on top of everything else allocating segments of time towards each project. 

Budget

WHAT WILL WE DO WITH THE FUNDS? 

The funds will first be used towards material for the dresses, production, labels, trade shows, marketing and everything we need to get the production done and the product in the hands of customers. Once we reach our goal, we are going to grow SheRoes Collection.

I’ll also be looking to hire a videographer to help create an artistic short fashion video to help bring my creations to life and have as an introduction to the collection before coming out on the catwalks. There will also be photography done too for promotional and advertisement purposes.

I’ve already planned and am looking ahead in researching costs for services and have been given quotes from various collaborators to help give me an idea on how to allocate funding.

Some of the key components the funding will be put towards include,

Operation Expenses: 1500 USD

- Extensive fabric resourcing

- Studio time, pattern drafting, designing
- Tailoring: Cutting, Sewing and sampling
- Manufacturing and maintenance of product
- Transportation Costs 
- Logistics and back-office expenses 


Capital Expenses: 1000 USD

- New equipments and machines
- A computer for the billing process
- E-commerce development


Contribution Expenses: 500 USD
- Printing Ad Materials
- Research
- Content Writing
- Model Photo shoot
- Digital Media Marketing


Personnel Expenses: 1000 USD
- Executive Director
- Counselling Director
- Designing Mentor
- At least 5 tailors/workmen
- E-commerce content developer
- Photographers and Models (In-Aid Contributions)

Your help will help us promote the SheRoes Collection Project on SnapDeals.com, on our website,  in stores, in media etc. We already have sold about 500 dresses at cafe SheRoes Hangout and the buyers are super excited about this-  but that means we need the product! For this project to be successful in keeping up the quality of design work that I’m aiming to achieve, I’m looking to raise around 3000 USD or more if I should be seen lucky enough!

       

I am trying to make my friends happy

You can watch this documentary to see how my friend Ritu changed her mind who had stopped wearing red dresses after the attack. The day she was attacked, Ritu was wearing a red dress. Ritu had bought a red dress on 18th of May for birthday celebration of her niece. “It was a colour I had never worn before.” In the days that followed, the colour became a nightmare for Ritu. “On May 26 last year, campaign celebrated the day by making me wear a red dress designed by Rupa didi,” Ritu says in an interview.


Your Perks!

In donating towards our creative project I’ve created a quirky set of perks that is sure to brighten up even the darkest of days. Just a little way for me to personally say Thank You and to show that your support really means the world. 

1- Donate $100 and get any of the following designs in perk 

2- Donate $ 300 and get an exclusive design by Rupa & a copy of Bello
3. Donate $ 10 and I will send you a ‘thank you’ video message
4. Donate $ 25 and get a copy of calendar Bello, modeled by acid attack survivors
5. Donate $ 30 and get a dress & copy of Bello
6. Donate $ 50 & get a free lunch/dinner at SheRoes Hangout 

How do I tell you what size, color, or items I want?

When the campaign has successfully concluded, we will send out an email to collect information from you: Item requests, sizes, style choices and a few more details that will help me deliver your product successfully.

Press about my designs 

Daily Mail
The Globe & Mail 
The Independent
Cosmopolitan 
The Huffington Post 

Alja Zeera
CNN
Time Of India  
The Indian Express
Live Mint 
The Tribune

Thank you so much for supporting me and my SheRoes Boutique in achieving my target goal. It has been a fantastic kick starter to the journey ahead and I couldn't have imagined it any better without all your supporting belief by my side. The last seven years have been tough. I did not know that I will even think about my dreams. You friends have become my strength in my journey. I never imagined my dreams could come true but now I believe anything is possible. 
- Your friend, Rupa 

You can Volunteer for this project

Friends, who can participate in my boutique project, please register your skills on www.paltan.in 

- Expert Fashion Designer friends can guide me and help me making better designs.
- Social Media experts can help me getting more business.
- Merchandiser as I need to learn more from you.  
-  Knit designer
- Graphics designer and visualizer  
- Product Specialist

If you are interested, or if you would like more information on how you can volunteer for this project, please contact us on stopacidattacks@gmail.com

SHARE

Even if you can’t afford to contribute don't worry it's all ok you can still play a big part in helping me to achieve my goal. Spread the word to your family and friends and then ask them to do the same. Maybe they or you might know of someone who'd be up for making a contribution? 

Give me a Like on Facebook or a Follow on Twitter. The more people who get to hear about my collection and the campaign #StopAcidAttacks. 

And maybe try and use the Indiegogo share tools. I hear they really help. Thanks again. We need your help to get this project off the ground and appreciate your supporting our work!

Facebook: www.fb.com/StopAcidAttacks
Twitter: www.twitter.com/stopacidattacks
Youtube: www.youtube.com/user/StopAcidAttacks

story:
The Launch

Cyra and Linda hitting the launch button for this campaign during our launch party. This is our joy! Help us spread joy and sensual happiness to the world through Sen Kouros by donating!  


The Preamble

Founder Cyra Jane Hobson is a lifelong student of sculpture and art who found her passion stone carving in 2009. She has always wanted to become a designer in the adult industry and is always creating couture erotic accoutrements of one kind or another. In 2014, those threads came together when she designed eleven varied and elegant sex toys, each carved of a piece of gifted marble. These became the initial prototypes for production. Shortly afterwards, she hooked up with business partner Linda Cox and the design company Sen Kouros was born. 

The Sen Kouros

Drawn to beauty, we have always sought to adorn our bodies and our homes with finely crafted materials and textures; our erotica and erotic devices should be just as stimulating and just as fine. Each kouros is carved from fine Italian marble and hand sanded and sealed with body-safe sealants. Each has a personality and offers temperature play, internal and external massage, rocking g-spot functionality, and solid f*&!ing stimulation. 

Philosophically, our focus at Sen Kouros is on style and arousal, and we use only fine, natural materials in the creation of our products, carved and finished in the United States and Canada (and maybe someday Italy because that's romantic). We strive to support our local economies and our culture by partnering with industrial artisans and fostering creative and healthy work environments for our employees. Our clients' and employees' health and happiness are our priorities. 

We narrowed the initial prototypes down in focus and testing groups to three designs: The Lustre, The Cold Mistress, and The (____________), (which will be named by one of you)!  Each comes with its own handmade lined microfiber suede bag for storage and travel. 

For care and customer service instructions for your Sen Kouros, please refer to our website (www.senkouros.com   - tl;dr for here). 


Isn't It Cold?

If you want it to be! 

Marble and other stones hold temperature exceptionally well. You can prep the stone with warm water or friction if you don't prefer to start with its at rest temperature at "somewhat cooler than the room." During play, the kouros will heat up to slightly warmer than your body temperature, then hold and emanate that heat until you set it aside. If you do like it cold, they can go in the freezer or in a cold water bath! 

What We Need

This campaign and your support will allow us to bring our dreams to life and into the lives of discerning clients world-wide. We have poured a lot of sweat, equity and personal time to get this far. 

In order to facilitate production, we need your help to finish building out our design and finishing studio and to pay our production partners and employees with something more than the passion of our dreams. 

$40,000 will cover the tools and materials that we still need to purchase and the necessary funds for fulfillment and the infrastructure to build this business into a viable company that provides income for local stone cutters.

Our dream is that this is the beginning of a long, sustainable artistic relationship between the designer and her clientele. We have so many designs and ideas being thrown on the back burner! 

Your Reward

In addition to the awesome perks we are offering you, supporting Sen Kouros and helping launch this business successfully gives you an opportunity to take a small stand against mass production. By supporting a small, boutique brand you can help us bring beauty and sustainability into a market that is in need of more. Finally, a successful Sen Kouros launch means that more artists will have a venue for their product and an opportunity to earn a living doing what they love.

The Risks

Your personal risks are small. We have scaled our business plan to ensure that every supporter will receive their chosen reward, regardless of the eventual size of this campaign. The founders, Cyra Jane Hobson and Linda Cox, have a long and successful history of bringing new products to market and the project management expertise necessary to ensure success.

Help Us Make Some Noise

After all that, we also need more than your cash support. We really need your help in getting the word out to a larger audience. Do any of you know industry influencers? Luxury reviewers or retailers who might be interested? Any media outlets that might be interested in doing a story on the confluence of luxury and lust? Art and artistry? Send them our campaign! 

And Finally

Thank you! Thank you all! We love you!

Isn't It Cold?If you want it to be! Marble and other stones hold temperature exceptionally well. You can prep the stone with warm water or friction if you don't prefer to start with its at rest temperature at "somewhat cooler than the room." During play, the kouros will heat up to slightly warmer than your body temperature, then hold and emanate that heat until you set it aside. If you do like it cold, they can go in the freezer or in a cold water bath! What We NeedThis
campaign and your support will allow us to bring our dreams to life and into the lives of discerning clients world-wide.  We have poured a lot of sweat, equity and personal time to get this far. 

In order to facilitate production, we need your help to finish building out our design and finishing studio and to pay our production partners and employees with
something more than the passion of our dreams. 

$40,000
will cover the tools and materials that we still need to purchase and the necessary funds for fulfillment and the infrastructure to build
this business into a viable company that provides income for
local stone cutters.

Our dream is that this is the beginning of a long, sustainable artistic relationship between the designer and her clientele. We have so many designs and ideas being thrown on the back burner! 

Your
Reward
In addition to the awesome perks we are offering you, supporting
Sen Kouros and helping launch this business successfully gives you an
opportunity to take a small stand against mass production. By
supporting  a small, boutique brand you can help us bring beauty and
sustainability into a market that is in need of more. Finally, a successful Sen Kouros launch means that more artists will
have a venue for their product and an opportunity to earn a living
doing what they love.The
Risks
Your
personal risks are small.  We have scaled our business plan
to ensure that every supporter will receive their chosen reward,
regardless of the eventual size of this campaign. The
founders, Cyra Jane Hobson and Linda Cox, have a long and successful
history of bringing new products to market and the project management
expertise necessary to ensure success.

Help
Us Make Some Noise

After all that, we also need more than your cash support. We really need your help in getting
the word out to a larger audience.  Do any of you know industry
influencers?  Luxury reviewers or retailers who might be interested? 
Any media outlets that might be interested in doing a story on the
confluence of luxury and lust? Art and artistry? Send them our campaign! And FinallyThank you! Thank you all! We love you!

story:
"Sofroniev" is an innovative company created with the idea to produce goods, seen from an unusual angle, but in conformity with the well-known classic. We believe that the unconventional look at the visited places, combined with the familiar, classic-looking product will enable people to combine the memory of the place with their daily life. This combination is the secret of our business philosophy.

The founder of the company is Ludmil Sofroniev. His grandfather Sofron Pavlov was a saddler and was also engaged in shoe repairing. As a child, Ludmil Sofroniev was often with him and together they spent a long time. Somewhere at that time, the idea about his own product was born.

- How was this idea born, Mr. Sofroniev?


The idea about heels in the shape of architectural landmarks was born when I was a student at Svishtov Academy  in 2001. I could say I was inspired by a marketing lecture. The lecturer Assoc. Dr. Peter Banchev said then that there are a lot of things that can be invented. It isn’t necessary to be a nuclear physicist to have such ideas. Ideas that are in front of our eyes, but no one has made them up before. And he ended the lecture with: Think, think, think.

I came back at the campus and started  thinking what that idea could be. I imagined the man and the earth and wondered what could be figured out. I increased, then decreased people and the earth, and suddenly I noticed the Eiffel Tower. I imagined it on the person or under them.  What could it be? It can be a heel. But the total perception of elegant heels would be better to be turned upside down. If the Eiffel Tower as a landmark could be a heel, then the other architectural landmarks could also be. So everyone would have the opportunity to combine the memory of the place with their daily lives.

After graduating from university and started working the idea sank into oblivion. The work didn’t give me the opportunity to come back to the idea but whenever I had time to look around I started to think about it and asked myself whether my inaction will one day bring me disappointment that I have not tried to realize it. In nine years and an accident in my life I had the opportunity to devote more time to it and I promised myself to realize the idea. And even if I fail I won’t  get angry because have tried. I submitted an application for a patent in EU and US and I received it.

EU patent No.: 002102293-0001                                   US patent No.: US D731,160 S

   Today, the first product –ladies shoe with a heel resembling to an architectural landmark is a fact. I only need to develop templates for different numbers of heels and shoes to realize it on the market. I hope people will like my products and support me in its market realization.

The shoe is made of high-quality leather. On the inside, there is inner sole with memory foam placed assuring more comfort. At the bottom of the heel, there is a small piece of steel embedded for greater strength and stability.The heel caps are made of special material which prevents knocking while walking. They are more durable compared to other standard heel caps.

All these components contribute to the elegance, comfort, and durability of the shoe itself.

Everyone who ordered shoes will receive a letter from us to specify the size and model.

 $20 000 -  We will produce Eiffel Tower heel mold for all sizes of shoes and will produce the first series of models Sophia and Marie.

"Sofroniev" commercial activity is carried by Telbro Ltd.. Telbro Ltd. have business since 2010 with registration number 201168031 in Bulgaria; VAT number BG201168031. Telbro Ltd. is 100% owned by the founder Ludmil Sofroniev.
Bulgarian Commercial register
Timeline activities




For more information or if you would like to be a distributor please visit our website www.sofroniev.eu 
or send us an e-mail to: contact@sofroniev.eu

In the video we use a short motif of the song

"The World At My Feet" - Jake Roche & Daisy Head from "Rules Of Love"

If you like our shoes, please share it with friends.

story:
Buy Instinct™ Today – We're Now Shipping!

 
"Has the potential to make millions of peoples' lives safer."
– Brian Cornell, CEO of Target®
 

With 1, 2, or 3 clicks, Instinct lets chosen contacts know your live, updating location and if you’re safe, uneasy, or in an emergency. Traditional safety devices tend to treat complex situations as 0-to-100 emergencies. We built Instinct after listening to 100s of survivors, and we designed our Teal, Yellow, and Red tiers so you can get help before a situation goes from bad to worse.

Instinct is our second-generation device. In our first year in market, we’re proud that our Revolar Original wearable sent out over 30,000 alerts for users in more than 60 countries around the world. 

Use Revolar Instinct Everyday

Medical Alerts – Instinct makes it fast & easy to reach out to loved ones with your location and specific instructions. Unlike other devices, there are no fees for sending alerts.

(Messaging and data rates may apply.)

Student Safety – Instinct gives college students a simple, fast way to ask for help from friends. It also gives teenagers a discreet way to let parents know if a party is out of control or they need to be picked up.

Senior Safety – Many can’t afford $30/month for safety support; that's why Instinct has no ongoing fees. Plus, along with sending for help, it can be used to check in with family or to count steps when out on a run.

 

Customer Reviews

"Finally! A safety device that respects your intelligence. Have you ever bought a product or service that, designed with the best of intentions to be simple to use that your options are sometimes overly limited or restricted? Fortunately, the Revolar Instinct is simple to use, yet it also allows for a great deal of personalization to your individual preferences."  - Amazon Customer

"It is so comforting to know when my daughter is out and about that she will be able to communicate with others when she feels uncomfortable or scared. I like knowing that I and others will be able to pin point her location and get the help she needs if the occasion arises. I actually just got one for myself as there have been several car jackings lately, and I feel safer knowing I can get help with just a click away. What a great device to have." - Amazon Customer

"This product has exceeded all of my expectations. The product itself is beautiful and lightweight, allowing me to wear it with every outfit. I have the option to keep it hidden in my bra or wear it clipped on to the outside of my pants. The app interface and setup is also really simple and easy for anyone to use." - Amazon Customer

The Contact Experience

Contacts don't need the Revolar App to receive alerts, which are sent by text and/or email.

Text and email alerts contain a unique link to a map of the user's live location with personalized instructions from the user depending on the alert tier.

The Free Revolar App

This free mobile app allows you to connect Instinct to your smartphone, update your Revolar contact list, customize your alert messages, view your step count, contact Revolar Customer Care, cancel alerts with your PIN, and more.

Device Compatibility

Instinct sends alerts by connecting to your synced smartphone via Bluetooth, so it works anywhere in the world where your synced smartphone has data service or WiFi.

  • iPhone 4s and newer models; iOS 9.0+ required.
  • Android 5.0+ required*

*Exclusions apply, some makes/models may be unsupported. Please email hello@revolar.com if you have any questions about your smartphone's compatibility.

How Revolar Instinct Works

 

Safety You'll Love Wearing

We designed Instinct to be more than just the fastest way to send for help.

Instinct helps you stay in touch with positive Check-in messages, move more with step tracking, ditch uncomfortable situations with Ring Me, and get support in non-emergencies with Yellow Alerts. It even chirps to help you find it if it’s misplaced.

So why design Instinct with all this power? Because if you love wearing Instinct every day, it will be there when you need it.

Frequently Asked Questions

What are the dimensions of Revolar Instinct?
Revolar Instinct is about the size of a quarter, so you can wear it anywhere.

Exact dimensions: 1.3 in x 1.06 in x 0.4 in
 
How water resistant is the Revolar Instinct?
Revolar Instinct is IP-68 waterproof. "IP" is the international standard for Ingress Protection, and 6 and 8 are the highest ratings for solids (dust) and liquids (water). In short, your Instinct can be submerged in up to 2 meters of water for approximately 30 minutes without an issue. So feel free to take it to the beach, or don't sweat it if it ends up in the wash.

Do I need to have my smartphone with me to use Revolar Instinct?
Yes, Revolar Instinct connects to your smartphone using Bluetooth® low energy, so you never have to pay an additional monthly fee for discreetly alerting friends and family. Revolar Instinct and your smartphone need to be within Bluetooth range (~30 ft to 50 ft) of each other during use.
 
Does Revolar Instinct drain the battery life of my smartphone?
Barely. Revolar Instinct is able to conserve energy by using Bluetooth low energy, which means Instinct uses much less battery life than other types of Bluetooth products.

Do I need to charge Revolar Instinct?
Nope! We understand the benefit of having one less device to charge. Revolar Instinct uses a coin cell CR2032 battery, which lasts 6 months to a year, depending on use. When you get below 10% battery life, we'll let you know so you can order a fresh battery (CR2032's are just a couple bucks at your local convenience store).

Are iPads or other tablets compatible with the Revolar Instinct?
Revolar Instinct can sync to some Wi-Fi + Cellular tablets, however many tablets aren't compatible at this time. 

Can I use my Revolar wearable while traveling internationally?
Yes, travel on! As long as you have a data plan and are within a coverage area provided by your smartphone carrier. Bluetooth and data must be enabled while traveling. Review our operating parameters for additional details.

Is the Revolar app available in multiple languages?
Yes! Currently, English and Spanish languages are supported. Due to the large variety of countries on our list of contributors, we have not yet been able to complete translations of the app for all countries.

Are there any ongoing fees?
Nope! There is no monthly fee to send alerts or to check in with your loved ones. Standard messaging and data rates may apply.

How much is shipping?
U.S. shipping is free! You'll see shipping fees outlined in the perk, and after you enter your country during checkout (before payment). For orders outside the U.S., any customs, duties, or taxes are the responsibility of the contributor. Please note that we are unable to mark orders as gifts to get around duties.

What if I have more questions?
Connect with our team at any time! Send us an email at hello@revolar.com.

story:
Benvenuti al Wearable Tech Torino 2016, la seconda edizione della fiera sulle tecnologie indossabili!

 

Wearable Tech Torino è la prima fiera in Italia e una delle più grandi in Europa dedicata interamente alle Wearable Technologies, organizzata da JEToP - Junior Enterprise Torino Politecnico.

 

L'edizione del 2016 sarà ad ingresso gratuito e si terrà il 18 e 19 novembre al Padiglione 1 del Lingotto Fiere di Torino e punta a migliorare, con il tuo aiuto e la tua partecipazione, i risultati ottenuti nel WTT 2015.

 

"La prima fiera sulla tecnologia indossabile è stata premiata come miglior progetto europeo del network internazionale delle Junior Enterprise."  La Repubblica

 

 

Le wearable technologies raggruppano una vasta categoria di dispositivi come:

-visori per la realtà aumentata e virtuale

-smartwatch e smartband

-tecnologie per il supporto alla disabilità

 

 

Edizione 2016:

Il nostro obiettivo per questa edizione è ingrandire la fiera, aumentando il numero di espositori e di prodotti, per farvi toccare con mano e provare ancora più novità.

Stiamo coinvolgendo scuole, enti del territorio e avvicinando il pubblico di ogni età ai wearable devices, indipendentemente dal tuo livello di conoscenza e di abilità potrai fare esperienza e imparare con queste tecnologie.

 

 

I numeri della prima edizione:

Abbiamo organizzato la prima edizione nel Novembre 2015 presso il padiglione 5 di Lingotto. Hanno partecipato 26 aziende e start up in rappresentanza delle ultime novità del mondo wearable. La fiera ha visto un susseguirsi di 6 Workshop e 28 Talk tenuti da esponenti di aziende quali: Samsung, Microsoft, Banca Mediolanum, Telecom, STMicroelectronics e Google Devéloper Group; alcuni orientati alla programmazione, al crowdfunding e alla realtà virtuale; altri dedicati sia più specificatamente al Wearable in ogni suo ambito, passando, per esempio, da quello medico a quello tessile, sia all’analisi dei suoi effetti sui Social Media e sulla nostra quotidianietà. 

La fiera ha vantato l’ingresso di ben 6000 persone in sole 48 ore.

 

 

CHI SIAMO:

JEToP, Junior Entreprise Torino Politecnico, è un’associazione no profit e apolitica gestita da studenti, con l’obiettivo di creare un contatto diretto tra il mondo del lavoro e il mondo dell’università.

I membri dell’associazione hanno piena autonomia nella gestione di progetti che oggigiorno coprono i seguenti ambiti: analisi di mercato, gestione risorse umane, servizi IT per le imprese, competenza nell’ambito di simulazione di gestione aziendale e, soprattutto, organizzazione di eventi.

Le competenze si sono concretizzate nel corso degli anni in attività come lo sviluppo di progetti commissionati da aziende, corsi di formazione, ma soprattutto organizzazione di eventi. JEToP é infatti stata la prima a portare un career day a Torino con Carriera&Futuro, che per oltre oltre vent’anni ha rappresentato un punto di incontro tra aziende e studenti neolaureati e laureandi. L’evento ha raccolto negli anni grandi successi, in particolare la XV Edizione, che ha conferito un importante riconoscimento: la medaglia offerta dalla Presidenza della Repubblica Italiana a seguito della concessione dell'alto patronato.

Il nostro tempo è a disposizione di un'idea in cui crediamo fortemente e alla quale dedichiamo ogni nostra risorsa.

Se credi anche tu in questo progetto e vuoi aiutarci a far sì che diventi sempre più grande puoi aiutarci con una donazione.

Il nostro giudice sei tu, ti aspettiamo in fiera.

Grazie!

Always one step forward

Il nostro giudice sei tu, ti aspettiamo in fiera.
Grazie!
Always one step forward

story:
Me & My project

 

 

Hi! my name is Giuseppe, I'm an italian consultant that is working as supplychain consultant in one of the famouse "big four" consulting firms.

It's a lot of time that I am thinking to start to work on this project...because.. I would like to solve the problem of a lot of men (mainly) and some women! I want to create CLOTHES POINT!

Clothes Point is a new revolutionary ecommerce site which for the first time sell to you a complete outfitt Ready-to-wear!

It is much more than just an ecommerce! We have partnered with many established brands and high quality new brand. Famouse or not, every brand could help you to compose your perfect look! 

Our idea to sell outfit ready to wear eliminates the time spent searching each comination... in particular if you are unable LIKE THE MOST OF THE MEN!

ECOMMERCE

Developments to our ecommerce website is that we want to firstly transform. 
We created it by ourselves, using a low cost website creation tool, but we really need a profesional that make it for us

We want that users will be able to search their favourite style navigating the website through some criteria like, Favourite fashion blogger, favourite style, ecc... and that the can have a tailored outfit proposal 

Marketing 

A big part of our job as a business, is to make sure we are marketing ourselves regularly. We want to continue to connect with potential users as much as we can to show them what we have to offer. Part of our marketing strategy is to connect where our users will be and that means marketing across various social media sites such as Facebook, Instagram, twitter and Tumblr. 

We are developing some funny video to promote it, but our resources are not unlimited

In addition other marketing aspects we want to include associations with up and coming Youtubers and celebrities. The effect of forming these associations with these celebrities and youtubers will enable their followers to become aware of Clothes Point and from there sign up to the site in order to stay connected.

App Development  

Social media is not only online anymore it is also on apps. This is why we want to use some of the money that we raise from our Kickstarter campaign to develop our very own Clothes Point app. 

You are no one without an APP!!!

In addition shopping online is also starting to take the path to apps themselves and so Clothes Point wants to stay ahead of the game and develop our app with our built in ecommerce page. 

So Overall What Are Our Plans For The Future?  

  • Create a better ecommerce website that suggest you the right outfit for you
  • Buy Stocks - Some suppliers have a MOQ (minimum order quantity) very high and we can't buy it at the moment
  • We want to add more established brands 
  • Marketing - We want to make Clothes Point what we think it can be and to make it as big as possible. To do this we want to have effective marketing campaigns to connect with our audience and help build a strong brand that people can trust and believe in. 
  • App development - To stay ahead of the game we want to bring our site as an app. 

Risks and challenges

Challenges we have faced! 
We have faced a lot of challenges to get where we are today but continue to overcome each challenge and push forward.

Way back when bwbtcs was just an idea and started to get our site developed we ran in to problems with our web designers and ultimately had to start from scratch all over again. Thank fully we are working with a great team to continue to develop our start day after day and we cannot wait until we can make bwbtcs what it can be.

Another challenge we faced initially was how to go about recruiting established businesses to join our site. This was an easy problem to overcome once we started to show theses business how bwbtcs can help them. And so with completely confident that we can continue to grow the number of businesses on our page giving our users thousands of products to choose from broadening their shopping horizons.

story:
Durée.

Diffuse and intensify yourself

 

So, what is Durée?

Durée is both fashionable and functional bracelet that diffuses, magnifies, intensifies, and lengthens the scent of your fragrance.

For some mysterious reason (actually volatile chemicals from a fragrance evaporates quiet quickly from our skin and clothes), unless we put on a tremendous amount of fragrance (until our nostrils start to hurt), the scent of our favorite perfume or cologne is gone by the time we get to that important meeting or by late afternoon.

Now, though, with a single spray on Durée, you can enjoy the most effective dispersal and a complete rendering of your favorite scent.

 

 

How does Durée work?

On the inside of Durée runs a thin lining of pure, organic plaster that absorbs the fragrance and evenly diffuses the scent.

The traditional advice for perfume application is that it should be dabbed on a pulse point to be effective as possible.

Placing Durée, right on the pulse point, enables the body heat generated from the pulse to magnify the scent.

 

 

The Design - Durée completes the fashion.

Adjectives that describe the design- casual, elegant, sleek, modern, ergonomic, delicate, chic, fashionable, fine, complete

Appearance

  • Casual, yet elegant- polished stainless steel cut with dim gray finish. Durée goes along with all types of fashion styles.
  • Ergonomically designed, Durée fits perfectly on both men and women’s wrist.
  • Sleek and modern design- perfect for daily usage

Inner beauty- never can be seen, yet can be sensed-scent

  • Aura with overture of chic- Durée deepens your charisma for long period of time.

3D modeling

Simple ergonomic design for daily use

Each separate parts were delicately designed 

 

How to use Durée

          Pick, Spray, Click, Go!

If you have more than one fragrance and like to change it, every-day, perhaps or for different occasions, it is ideal to have one Durée for each fragrance, (since the scent will last for about five days on Durée).

 

How long will the scent last?

Generally 0.25 ml is released per single spray of perfume. With Durée, however, the actually amount of fragrance absorbed is around 0.05 ml, and it is still effective!

Once sprayed on the surface of Durée, the scent will last about 38 hours. After 38 hours, the concentration of scent will gradually decline over 72 hours.

To enjoy Durée at its fullest, double sprays are recommended for men’s cologne and triple sprays are recommended for women’s perfume.

 

Risks and Challenges

All our manufactures are lined up and waiting for the green light confirmation, so delivery in 2017 is guaranteed. I will do everything in my power to achieve timely delivery; and will reach out to you in case of unforeseen circumstances. Once Durée is on its way to your wrist, delivery information will be provided for both domestic and international shipping. Please do not hesitate to email or message me directly with any concerns, questions, or comments.

I sincerely thank you for making this project come true.

story:
Our mission is to create classic Scandinavian designs that truly meet the bar set by other famous Scandinavian designers (but without the price-tag).

Who would you want to work with to achieve this? Jakob Wagner, of course. Jakob has worked with Bang & Olufsen, Hay, Muuto, and many more. We're not the only ones who really like his work - he's been handed multiple design awards, with one of his pieces now part of the permanent collection at MoMA, New York.

We are going to play our part in making sustainable change across the globe. Every watch will contribute to a meaningful cause, and the choice is handed over to the owner. All you need is the serial number from the case back, and the unique identification code from the Certificate of Authenticity to make your choice and follow the results.

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Philosopher is designed to be an instrument of time, and it celebrates our ability to think differently. The shape of the case is conical, with a base wider than its face, creating a sharp characteristic two-piece dial that brings us hurtling through time to this moment now. The watch case has an elevated, and clean brushed look because of the way that the lugs tug under it. The asymmetric second hand that appears to continuously slice through time reminds us to learn from the past, act now, and create a better future.

 

 

 

 

The Infinity is inspired by nature, and our relationship with the environment around us. This design removes complexity to arrive at simplicity, as if it was crafted by evolution itself. The cone shaped case, deep curved dial, and hourly marks that attach to the edge of the face move our imagination into thinking about the infinite space of the universe. While the way the strap slides directly into the case, without lugs, gives the watch a clean, round feel.

 

 

 

 

The Native is all about balance. Balance is the secret to the happy life of a Copenhagen local. This timepiece is a classic, completely redefined. Simple, yet sophisticated due to the attention to details. The elevated design is a result of the rounded case. The clean dial, subtle, light grey minute marks, and rounded lugs give the watch a classic, distinctive look. The concept is human-centered, and designed to be worn by anyone, anywhere.

 

 

 

 

 

All of our straps come with a "quick-release" function, allowing you to change the look of your watch within a matter of seconds. And best of all, no tools are needed.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hi there!

We are Vasilij Brandt and Pascar Sivam, co-founders of Nordgreen. We began our journey with Nordgreen at the beginning of 2017, and we've loved every minute of it so far. We are delighted to finally bring you our watches.

We have wanted to create a watch brand since our teenage years, so we're truly excited about finally making our dream a reality with Nordgreen.

We’re born-and-bred Danes on a mission to deliver an iconic series of watches inspired by traditional Scandinavian design, incorporating the core Scandinavian values of generosity and social responsibility.

We are proud to announce our partnership with one of the leading Scandinavian designers, Jakob Wagner, as well as the inspiring NGOs Pratham UK, Water For Good, and Cool Earth.

Thanks for taking the time to check out our project, and we hope that you will join Nordgreen on our journey.

All the best,

Vasilij and Pascar

 

Have a question that you need answered? We are here to help! You can check the FAQ at the bottom of the page to see if if your question has already been answered. Or, you can drop us a line at hello@nordgreen.com or send us a message here:

 

If you live outside of the EU/EEA, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. NOTE: While we wish we could help get our packages to you faster, we have no control over custom processing times.

Photo Credits:

Ashton Wowchuk & Anne-Sophie Hermans

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Delivery time: We are working closely with our manufacturer to make sure production goes smoothly. We will do what we can to deliver before the expected delivery dates!

Infinity, 40mm, Silver
 
Native, 36mm, Rose Gold

Ashton Wowchuk & Anne-Sophie Hermans

story:
London College of Fashion, MA Fashion Curation presents ARCHETYPE: The Art of Deconstructing Bespoke exhibition in celebration of menswear and British Bespoke Tailoring.

 

A bespoke jacket is all about the man who wears it, it is about his personality and what makes him the unique individual he is. Patterns and fittings become tailored archetypes of this individual man, mirroring his life, lifestyle and his silhouette. As time goes by, history and craftsmanship behold, preserving the original essence, elegance and function of its wearer's bespoke jacket.

Drawing from the art of British Tailoring, particularly that of Bespoke, the exhibition ARCHETYPE: The Art of Deconstructing Bespoke invites visitors to discover the narratives behind the garments and create their own stories through the fetishized details that tell so much about the wearer.

 

Date: Wednesday 28th March 2013 - Sunday 6th April 2013
Kingly Court, Carnaby Street, London W1B 5PW

 

With your support, we will be able to:

- Hire a venue
- Transport objects safely and securely
- Purchase display materials
- Produce an exhibition catalogue
- Print promotional materials and invitations


The visitors would also benefit tremendously from your generosity!


MA Fashion Curation 2013

Francoise Assamoi
Kathryn Olivia Bonnar
Nadia Saccardi
Tianyi Zhang
Xinyu Zhou
Chenyang Huang

ma.fc.lcf@gmail.com
