story:
Thank you for visiting my project page.  

My name is Nicolette Lazarus, founder and creative director at                    L for LAZARUS, an innovative fashion accessories brand based in Amsterdam. 

L for LAZARUS create unique, stylish yet practical fashion accessories. It's a brand women for who love to follow fashion but, more importantly, have developed an inner confidence and their own personal sence of style.  

It's a brand for women who are comfortable with who they are, and know what they want from fashion accessories: style, quality, versatility, and the ability to transform their look on a daily basis.

In March 2011, I left my career in advertising to set up                L for LAZARUS.  And in October, I successfully launched my first product, the Échapeau, a stylish yet practical hat and scarf combination that can be worn:
- As one stylish piece 
- Or as a classic hat & scarf set 
- Or as individual items.

You can read more about L for LAZARUS by scrolling down. But first, let me present my Fall/Winter 2012 Collection, because the $20,000 I need is to manufacture these great pieces; and because these are the incentives I’m offering in return for your support.

They'll make a great addition to your wardrobe and earn you plenty of kudos when given as a gift!  

In other words, if you like what you see,  use this project to pre-order and help us out in the process!

L for LAZARUS Fall/Winter 2012 Collection (and your great incentives)  

The Lana Wrap Recommended Retail Price/R.R.P. $149
With its flattering diagonal drape that narrows and elongates the silhouette, the cosy Lana Wrap is the definition of easy sophistication as the temperature drops.  
 
Wear it in at least five ways, with or without your favourite belt; over anything from skinny jeans, little black dress or leather jacket to create countless looks of layered luxury with one piece. 
 
Available in beige, black, bordeaux, grey, oatmeal and olive, the Lana Wrap is the unique new style layer.
 
50% wool/ 50% polyester
Size 1 Approx. 85 x 115 cm
Size 2 Approx. 90 x 120 cm 
Model's (176-189 cm tall) wear Size 2

 
L for LAZARUS Bags

Crafted from beautifully soft leather, the L for LAZARUS bag collection is chic but also functional.  All you have to do is add your style! 
Available in black, bronze, gunmetal grey and metallic blue.
 
Lakota Large Tote Bag R.R.P. $249
The name Lakota means ‘friend’, and this large, light bag will quickly become yours. The quality leather molds beautifully to your body, adding effortless chic to your casual looks.  
 
Whether holding just your bare essentials or packed full on a day you ‘didn’t mean to buy anything’, the roomy Lakota is your ideal companion.  
Approx. size: 70 x 12 x 34 cm 
 
 
 
Luvena 'Stay Put' Shoulder Bag R.R.P. $119 
Luvena means ‘little beloved one’, and once you’ve tried this versatile classic, it will become one of your prized possessions.
 
It fits snugly under your arm and stays on your shoulder whether you’re out having cocktails or running around with the kids.
 
Perfect for when you need a bag but wished you didn’t have to carry one!  
Approx. size: 27 x 10 x 14 cm
 
 
 
Lucia Make-Up Bag R.R.P. $89
The ingenious Lucia make-up bag is crafted using the finest leather on one side, and 
totally transparent on the other, offering clear and stylish benefits for anyone on the move.
 
The name Lucia means ‘bringer of light’, and with this clever mix of style and practicality, you’ll never have to search for your favorite lipstick again.  
Approx. size: 27 x 2.5 x 14 cm 
 
 
Lakia Wallet R.R.P. $59 (Limited edition*) 
Style and practicality were again top of mind for the design of the Lakia leather wallet, as an incentive for this Indiegogo project. Lakia means ‘treasure’, and with its crafted lattice work front and three zip compartments, it will keep your ‘pieces of eight’, cards, I.D’s and receipts close to hand…it can even hold your i-phone.  
Approx. size: 14 x 10.5 cm 
* In gunmetal grey or bronze. Not available for general purchase.  

The Échapeau 
Derived from the French words for scarf and hat (écharpe and chapeau), the Échapeau is an elegant combination of both that can be worn as one unique piece, as a classic hat & scarf set or as individual items.

Each model is available in a range of high quality, wool-rich fabrics.  Visit the Gallery to see the full range and click here for the size guide. 

The Lola Échapeau R.R.P $125

 oror

The Livvy Échapeau 

Beige, Grey R.R.P. $125  Tweed, Tartan, Herringbone and Shower-proof Black R.R.P $135

oror

Background to L for LAZARUS

My mother taught me from an early age that although fashion was important, it was even more important to know what suited me, and to develop my own personal style.

With L for LAZARUS, I set out to challenge some fashion industry 'rules' because:

- The industry is based on designers producing entire collections, even if only a few items are really innovative. 

- Each season, women rarely buy multiple pieces from the same designer.

- There’s little true fashion innovation, and if it's really innovative, then little of it is truly wearable.

But I love the idea of personal style and wearable innovation.  I did my research and found out that I’m not alone; the women I spoke with told me that they wanted timeless, beautifully-made items that:

- Enhance their personal style

- Work with their current wardrobe for multiple seasons

- Are as versatile as they are

- And thus represent value for money.

So I set myself the task to create pieces that are stylish, practical, and versatile.

Why I need your help

To date, everything for L for LAZARUS has been self-funded and by calling in favours from my extremely talented friends who include photographers and models.  I currently do everything myself from design and sourcing to production, marketing and sales.

This project is to raise $20,000 to actually manufacture the new L for LAZARUS Fall/Winter collection.  Everything has been designed, sampled, and photographed and I have retailers and webshops who want to take the collection, but as I'm a new brand, most of the deals I have are on a consignment basis.  I have only until the end of this project before I need to place final orders. But with your help, the collection will be available for general purchase this September.    

What the funds will be used for

- Manufacture of the new collection pieces you've seen above

- Artwork & print for labels and hangtags 

- An intern to help me out one day a week 

- P.R. support to contact bloggers, journalists etc. to help promote the collection

- The Indiegigo fee (4-9% of the total raised)

Any additional funds raised will go towards production of samples for the L for LAZARUS Spring/Summer 2013 collection.   I've got some great new ideas and found some excellent production partners.

Every contribution, no matter how small, is greatly appreciated.

And there are also incentives to 'spread the word' about this project, even if you can't contribute financially...

Just share this video in your social networks or blog to enter the FREE PRIZE DRAW to win one of these great prizes:

1st prize     Lakota bag 

2nd prize    Lana wrap 

3rd prize     The Livvy or Lola Échapeau 

4th prize     Lucia Shoulder Bag 

5th prize     Luvena Make-Up Bag 

6th prize     Lakia Wallet 

All you have to do is:

- Post this video (and comment why you're excited by this project)

- Let us know you've posted on our Indiegogo comments page, or via e-mail to info@lforlazarus.com, with the link(s) or a screen grab. 

You'll receive one entry for your first post and five entries for each additional post.

If you have any questions or feedback I'd love to hear from you, either through the comments page, or via e-mail at info@lforlazarus.com   

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT

My dad taught me that I can do anything I set my mind to, and I know that with my hard work, and your support, I will make L for LAZARUS a success.  I hope you'll become an L for LAZARUS 'Contributor to Style' and join me on this exciting journey to bring to life unique, stylish yet practical fashion accessories. 

And I'd like to add a HUGE personal thank you to all my talented friends who've given freely of their time, advice, expertise and beauty to support me.

FAQ's

Where will L for LAZARUS be available?   If we meet our Indiegogo target, L for LAZARUS will be available from various boutiques and young designer shops in Amsterdam and Austria; on-line at web shops including Not On The High Street, The London Designer Forum, Bottica and the L FOR LAZARUS web shop. 

Payment   I'm requesting contributions are made via PayPal; that way there's no credit card handling charges.  You can use your credit card to pay securely via PayPal, you don't even have to set up an account!

When will I get my incentives?  I'm aiming to get delivery early September.

Sizing for the Échapeau  Please check the L for LAZARUS website to see the size guide and the sizes available per style. Please add your style, colour and size choice when selecting the Échapeau as a perk.

Contribution to postage NO NEED TO ADD POSTAGE IF YOU LIVE IN AMSTERDAM AND CAN MEET ME IN PERSON TO COLLECT YOUR INCENTIVE! Postage is pretty expensive.  For example, it costs over $30 to send some of the collection items to the U.S.A.  But I wanted to keep the cost as transparent as possible and, as I'm trying to raise much needed funds, I'm therefore asking for a contribution towards the postage cost of each item.
story_txt:
Thank you for visiting my project page.  
My name is Nicolette Lazarus, founder and creative director at                    L for LAZARUS, an innovative fashion accessories brand based in Amsterdam. 
L for LAZARUS create unique, stylish yet practical fashion accessories. It's a brand women for who love to follow fashion but, more importantly, have developed an inner confidence and their own personal sence of style.  
It's a brand for women who are comfortable with who they are, and know what they want from fashion accessories: style, quality, versatility, and the ability to transform their look on a daily basis.
In March 2011, I left my career in advertising to set up                L for LAZARUS.  And in October, I successfully launched my first product, the Échapeau, a stylish yet practical hat and scarf combination that can be worn:
- As one stylish piece 
- Or as a classic hat & scarf set 
- Or as individual items.
You can read more about L for LAZARUS by scrolling down. But first, let me present my Fall/Winter 2012 Collection, because the $20,000 I need is to manufacture these great pieces; and because these are the incentives I’m offering in return for your support.
They'll make a great addition to your wardrobe and earn you plenty of kudos when given as a gift!  
In other words, if you like what you see,  use this project to pre-order and help us out in the process!
L for LAZARUS Fall/Winter 2012 Collection (and your great incentives)  

The Lana Wrap Recommended Retail Price/R.R.P. $149
With its flattering diagonal drape that narrows and elongates the silhouette, the cosy Lana Wrap is the definition of easy sophistication as the temperature drops.  
 
Wear it in at least five ways, with or without your favourite belt; over anything from skinny jeans, little black dress or leather jacket to create countless looks of layered luxury with one piece. 


 
Available in beige, black, bordeaux, grey, oatmeal and olive, the Lana Wrap is the unique new style layer.
 
50% wool/ 50% polyester



Size 1 Approx. 85 x 115 cm

Size 2 Approx. 90 x 120 cm 
Model's (176-189 cm tall) wear Size 2




 
L for LAZARUS Bags

Crafted from beautifully soft leather, the L for LAZARUS bag collection is chic but also functional.  All you have to do is add your style! 

Available in black, bronze, gunmetal grey and metallic blue.
 

Lakota Large Tote Bag R.R.P. $249

The name Lakota means ‘friend’, and this large, light bag will quickly become yours. The quality leather molds beautifully to your body, adding effortless chic to your casual looks.  
 
Whether holding just your bare essentials or packed full on a day you ‘didn’t mean to buy anything’, the roomy Lakota is your ideal companion.  
Approx. size: 70 x 12 x 34 cm 
 

 
 

Luvena 'Stay Put' Shoulder Bag R.R.P. $119 

Luvena means ‘little beloved one’, and once you’ve tried this versatile classic, it will become one of your prized possessions.
 
It fits snugly under your arm and stays on your shoulder whether you’re out having cocktails or running around with the kids.
 
Perfect for when you need a bag but wished you didn’t have to carry one!  
Approx. size: 27 x 10 x 14 cm
 

 
 

Lucia Make-Up Bag R.R.P. $89

The ingenious Lucia make-up bag is crafted using the finest leather on one side, and 
totally transparent on the other, offering clear and stylish benefits for anyone on the move.
 

The name Lucia means ‘bringer of light’, and with this clever mix of style and practicality, you’ll never have to search for your favorite lipstick again.  



Approx. size: 27 x 2.5 x 14 cm 
 
 

Lakia Wallet R.R.P. $59 (Limited edition*) 


Style and practicality were again top of mind for the design of the Lakia leather wallet, as an incentive for this Indiegogo project. Lakia means ‘treasure’, and with its crafted lattice work front and three zip compartments, it will keep your ‘pieces of eight’, cards, I.D’s and receipts close to hand…it can even hold your i-phone.  
Approx. size: 14 x 10.5 cm 

* In gunmetal grey or bronze. Not available for general purchase.  
The Échapeau 
Derived from the French words for scarf and hat (écharpe and chapeau), the Échapeau is an elegant combination of both that can be worn as one unique piece, as a classic hat & scarf set or as individual items.
Each model is available in a range of high quality, wool-rich fabrics.  Visit the Gallery to see the full range and click here for the size guide. 
The Lola Échapeau R.R.P $125

 oror

The Livvy Échapeau 
Beige, Grey R.R.P. $125  Tweed, Tartan, Herringbone and Shower-proof Black R.R.P $135

oror

Background to L for LAZARUS
My mother taught me from an early age that although fashion was important, it was even more important to know what suited me, and to develop my own personal style.
With L for LAZARUS, I set out to challenge some fashion industry 'rules' because:
- The industry is based on designers producing entire collections, even if only a few items are really innovative. 
- Each season, women rarely buy multiple pieces from the same designer.
- There’s little true fashion innovation, and if it's really innovative, then little of it is truly wearable.
But I love the idea of personal style and wearable innovation.  I did my research and found out that I’m not alone; the women I spoke with told me that they wanted timeless, beautifully-made items that:
- Enhance their personal style
- Work with their current wardrobe for multiple seasons
- Are as versatile as they are
- And thus represent value for money.
So I set myself the task to create pieces that are stylish, practical, and versatile.
Why I need your help
To date, everything for L for LAZARUS has been self-funded and by calling in favours from my extremely talented friends who include photographers and models.  I currently do everything myself from design and sourcing to production, marketing and sales.
This project is to raise $20,000 to actually manufacture the new L for LAZARUS Fall/Winter collection.  Everything has been designed, sampled, and photographed and I have retailers and webshops who want to take the collection, but as I'm a new brand, most of the deals I have are on a consignment basis.  I have only until the end of this project before I need to place final orders. But with your help, the collection will be available for general purchase this September.    
What the funds will be used for
- Manufacture of the new collection pieces you've seen above
- Artwork & print for labels and hangtags 
- An intern to help me out one day a week 
- P.R. support to contact bloggers, journalists etc. to help promote the collection
- The Indiegigo fee (4-9% of the total raised)
Any additional funds raised will go towards production of samples for the L for LAZARUS Spring/Summer 2013 collection.   I've got some great new ideas and found some excellent production partners.
Every contribution, no matter how small, is greatly appreciated.
And there are also incentives to 'spread the word' about this project, even if you can't contribute financially...
Just share this video in your social networks or blog to enter the FREE PRIZE DRAW to win one of these great prizes:
1st prize     Lakota bag 
2nd prize    Lana wrap 
3rd prize     The Livvy or Lola Échapeau 
4th prize     Lucia Shoulder Bag 
5th prize     Luvena Make-Up Bag 
6th prize     Lakia Wallet 
All you have to do is:
- Post this video (and comment why you're excited by this project)
- Let us know you've posted on our Indiegogo comments page, or via e-mail to info@lforlazarus.com, with the link(s) or a screen grab. 
You'll receive one entry for your first post and five entries for each additional post.
If you have any questions or feedback I'd love to hear from you, either through the comments page, or via e-mail at info@lforlazarus.com   
THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT
My dad taught me that I can do anything I set my mind to, and I know that with my hard work, and your support, I will make L for LAZARUS a success.  I hope you'll become an L for LAZARUS 'Contributor to Style' and join me on this exciting journey to bring to life unique, stylish yet practical fashion accessories. 
And I'd like to add a HUGE personal thank you to all my talented friends who've given freely of their time, advice, expertise and beauty to support me.
FAQ's
Where will L for LAZARUS be available?   If we meet our Indiegogo target, L for LAZARUS will be available from various boutiques and young designer shops in Amsterdam and Austria; on-line at web shops including Not On The High Street, The London Designer Forum, Bottica and the L FOR LAZARUS web shop. 
Payment   I'm requesting contributions are made via PayPal; that way there's no credit card handling charges.  You can use your credit card to pay securely via PayPal, you don't even have to set up an account!
When will I get my incentives?  I'm aiming to get delivery early September.
Sizing for the Échapeau  Please check the L for LAZARUS website to see the size guide and the sizes available per style. Please add your style, colour and size choice when selecting the Échapeau as a perk.
Contribution to postage NO NEED TO ADD POSTAGE IF YOU LIVE IN AMSTERDAM AND CAN MEET ME IN PERSON TO COLLECT YOUR INCENTIVE! Postage is pretty expensive.  For example, it costs over $30 to send some of the collection items to the U.S.A.  But I wanted to keep the cost as transparent as possible and, as I'm trying to raise much needed funds, I'm therefore asking for a contribution towards the postage cost of each item.

story:
Who are we?

Hi there! We're Layne and Shaye and we're elite-level cheerleaders living in North Vancouver, Canada. 

We love cheer and we love our mom. Cheer, mom, cheer, mom. CHEER MOM! 

Our mom has supported our passion for cheer for 9 years. She works really hard to make sure that we get to do what we love but its a struggle because she works in non-profit and doesn't make a ton of money.

We were trying to work out a way to help her when we learned about Indiegogo. We figured that we could create an online community that shows people how important cheer (and sport) has been in our lives. We do well in school, we don't do any of the bad stuff some kids do and we train...a lot. So we think we'd be good cheer role models.

Cheer is an elite sport, like hockey, so its expensive. For both of us its $7,000 this year. We're hoping that we can have people follow us on the road to the World Championships in April and have them feel part of this great YEAR OF CHEER!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $7,000 in order to pay for the extra training, choreography, uniforms, practice gear, shoes, travel, travel accommodation etc. But we also feel that if we raise more we want to help out some other kids at our club who have trouble covering the costs too.

We have some really fun perks including a TRIBZSIBZ limited edition t-shirt with our cool logo. (comes with the $75, $100 and $150 perks!!)

We're hoping to build a full-on TRIBZSIBZ following and we want as many people as possible to follow us as we work toward our goal to get to Worlds. How cool would it be to see some of our shirts at cheer events? 

Why We're Doing This

I (Layne) have a learning disability that was diagnosed in grade 2 and Shaye was diagnosed with Crohn's Disease this year. (To learn more about Crohn's check out http://www.ccfc.ca/site/c.ajIRK4NLLhJ0E/b.6429681/k.AF7A/CCFC.htm)

This is what Shaye looked like when she was really sick :(

We want to show people that no matter what challenges you face in life, sport can really help you build self-esteem and know what it means to be involved in something bigger than yourself. 

Our mom is always talking about "perspective" so even through our parents divorce we were never allowed to feel sorry for ourselves. She shows us how other people have it and how we're so fortunate. 

Now that we're 12 and 15 we realize we're fortunate because she has made some pretty major sacrifices for us to do what we love. 

We want to pay that forward by helping her and maybe helping some other families too. 

Everyone should know what it feels like to work toward their dream. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please share our TRIBZSIBZ online stuff with your friends. We're on Facebook at https://facebook.com/tribzsibz and on Instagram and Vine. 
  • Indiegogo has a ton of cool sharing tools so if you can't contribute please share this with your friends, family, teammates etc. 

Anything you can do would be really appreciated!
